Name: SleelWheels
Story:
So I got held up by the same slow moving freight train at, THREE, different crossings.

yeh, that happened.

#ridesharelife

Name: BigBadBob
Story: Picked up a youngish Asian woman today. Indian lady. After I dropped her off, I used nearly a whole can of Ozium, windows open, no pick ups for half an hour. Just to get rid of the smell

Name: Cvillegordo
Story: In spite of reading many posts warning against these, I took one the other day, snapped a photo when he wasn't looking. My car STILL smells like Downy. (BUT he tipped!)

Name: rkozy
Story:
I'm fascinated by the nice-sounding names they have given some of these Section 8 Hell holes. I'll start by listing the top trouble spots in my market (Davenport, IA/Moline, IL)...

Heatherton
Americana Park
Castlewood
Magnolia Drive
Douglas Park
Maple Ridge
Century Woods
Watertown
Spring Brook Courts
Loma Linda

Share your dreaded pick-up spots, giving the neighborhood name or apartment complex. The more non-threatening they sound, the better.

Name: TXUbering
Story:
I was in a hellish part of town the other night in an area with a lot of bars and restaurants. Typically the pax just want you to shuttle them from one bar to another, which isn't worth the headache. But, I figured I'd go ahead and play the role of good ant and accepted the request. 

I find the location of the pick-up and decided I didn't want to be "that ant", and hold up traffic waiting for my pax. So, I pull off into a side street and wait parked next to the building, right at the pincushion. I sat there waiting for my pax when 3 clowns decided for whatever reason to stand right next to my passenger door, somewhat inhibiting my view, and peoples' view of my vehicle. Attempted to contact the pax several times, no answer. 

Five minutes later (stupid Comfort 7 minute wait), and still no sign of her. Look over and the 3 jackasses are still just standing there. One of the asshats decides he wants to lean his hand on my car, to which I slowly put the car in reverse, and clip his arm with my side mirror. With the windows rolled up, I still manage to hear him say, "You could've asked!" I responded in turn with, "Get off my &#^@ car!" I was actually hoping that they'd start something as I was already getting frustrated by the most likely drunk woman making me wait. But, they just decided to walk down the street with no drama. 

I'm not sure what planet that dillhole was from where he actually thought that I needed to ASK him to get off my car. It's not a park bench, it's my personal property ya schmuck! 

Waited the full 7 minutes and decided to just shuffle her. Oh well, $9.00 for nothing. My guess is she was trying to catch the last few minutes of a college game and thought I'd wait for her past the wait time.

Name: Erik M
Story:
Drove last night for Uber, mostly in Orange County (CA), and the multiplier rides started coming in at around 9pm! First one came in at 3.6x, then 4.2x and so on. 5 or 6 rides came in with the old multiplier. I even logged off because Gryft was paying $32 starting price power zones in downtown Costa Mesa then logged back into Uber and it was still doing it.

Ahh, It was just like Old Times!!

Name: Haanjo
Story:
Actually, it was more like 35 seconds...

Last night I had a Lyft pickup at a pool (billiards) bar at around 12:30 am.

After about a minute and a half of waiting, a guy comes out and says, "Wow, you were fast", not realizing he had been in my que for close to 25 minutes, and was less than 2 miles from my last drop off. He then goes back into the bar.

At around the 4 minute mark, he comes back out and says he is waiting for his friend, and proudly says he will make it worth my while if I wait. I simply respond with the universal "ok, ok". At that point I explain to him that he has about 30 seconds...and he runs into the bar to get his friend.

The clock ticks down to zero, and he still hasn't shown up, so naturally I bolt. With around 11,000 Uber and Lyft rides to date, I no longer mess around. I'm serious when I say you have 30 seconds...

As I take off, I hear him yell, "That wasn't 30 seconds, sir", but the reality is that it was closer to 35 seconds...or more accurately 5 minutes and five seconds or so.

I don't get why so many people take so long to get ready. In my case, whenever I book Lyft ride, I'm ready before the driver gets to my pickup location. In this case, I get that my rider was probably finishing up a game of pool, but at this stage of the game, I don't put up with the BS I put up with when I was a new driver, and I won't hesitate to leave you behind if you are not ready, or if you chose to socialize with your friends for even 3 minutes...I will not hesitate to leave you behind if you don't give me the same respect as I given other Lyft drivers when they pick me up.

Do you feel the same way?

Name: Fusion_LUser
Story: Yeah.. Yeah... Yeah... Right back at you, Uber!

Name: Fare Chaser
Story:
This video shows the entire ride, start to finish. I sped up the parts with no dialogue. Here's a summary:

0:00-0:34 - greeting and confirmation of destination. Pax has an obvious bad attitude from the start.
1:59-2:15 - Pax sends me a text through app: "I don't like your music, [name]". I ask her "You don't like my music? You want me to turn it off?" to which she remains silent. I switch off the radio. At this point I start to worry about this pax. This was the most bizarre thing to happen during my 2000~ rides.
3:25-end - I ask the pax, "So, now I'm curious, what kind of music do you like to listen to?" to which she responds "I don't have any interest in speaking with you." That's when I pulled over to cancel the ride. That's when the fireworks happen.

Notes: 1) I have a big, obvious wedding band on my ring finger, I don't flirt with pax, and this one wasn't even attractive. 2) We had listened to Beatles' "Here Comes The Sun", but apparently she really didn't like listening to Pink Martini's rendition of "Bolero". 3) I am starting a new job very soon, so my tolerance for pax bullshit is at an all-time low. None of them ever get to treat me like The Help in my own car ever again. Deactivation from a false accusation from her, or from posting this video online? I don't care.

Name: kingcorey321
Story:
God help us food drivers ! 
The food delivery market took a serious downturn last week and it has zero momentum to pull back up .
So the solution ? Get the old vacuum cleaner out and the 4 year old armor all . 
First carwash in a year ! And the dog hair !! I drive with two dogs delivering food .
Three hours cleaning . The car was a bit over due . 
Ok to the point nobody cares about all the info i posted above lmao . 
20 rides today. Very busy pax market . Keep in mind i am not a rookie with pax About 5500 or 6000 rides 
My car i have a ipad playing you tube videos . I got one report in the app. ( He was watching movies and driving )
Second issue kiss my butt . ( He took both hands off the wheel . He drove with his knee )
Third report ( He was not wearing a mask ) 
I do not miss delivering food. Hoping after the holiday it goes back to normal . 
The ipad is not coming out of the car . I will not wear a mask . I will not use my hands when not needed to make a pax feel safe . Kick me off the app ! Have a great holiday everyone burn some food on the bbq

Name: BigBadBob
Story: Had a cop in my car the other say. 35 minute trip. Mostly talked about music. Cop was old enough to be my son. Nice guy. He told me that Uber drivers are like friends. We pick up the dross before they do. He has never ticketed an Uber driver. They usually run your license as it shows as a 'contact' So, unless you have any warrants, its all good. I never had a ticket driving with Uber. The cops who lit me up usually explain the errors of my ways. Usually speeding in a 25 zone. I seem to have trouble at that speed. Just an interesting observation.

Name: Uberingdude
Story: We are in the business of picking up strangers. That can get scary at times. Have you ever found yourself in a potentially dangerous situation before?

Name: ANT 7
Story:
Some of you may remember my post about the fight in the drive thru line up of a few weeks ago.

Today, wifey and I are in her SUV getting a couple of diet cokes and the car in front of us is taking forever to collect her grub. It seems "Karen" didn't get any "extra" pickles on the 8 burgers she ordered (yes I saw her checking them all thru her back window).

JFC !!!!

After about 5 minutes of back and forth between her and the drive thru clerk Karen huffs and puffs and drives away with her bag because she won't pay more for extra pickles over and above what she has been given in the burgers already. I pull up to collect my drinks and ask the woman working the window "can I get pickles with that ?"

She laughs so hard and drops one of my drinks on the floor.

Name: ANT 7
Story:
Why yes you are.

I cancelled within .0005 of a second upon receiving that pax text today.

Name: kdyrpr
Story:
Picked up at the airport, pax got in after I loaded 2 heavy suitcases. Nice enough lady and we headed out for about a 45 minute trip. Her rear window was 3/4 open and told her that she could control the window any way she preferred. She said she was OK with it open. Since the trip was nearly all on the highway I did mention that she may want to close it. I didn't think I had to explain the noise factor and other issues when your vehicle is traveling 70mph with a window open. 

The window stayed open the entire way. Since the conditions were not conducive to any type of conversation the entire trip was silent. 

Arrived at the destination unloaded her luggage and that was it. 

I had been mulling over the entire ride how I was going to rate. Keep in mind that I nearly always rate a 5. At least 98% of the time. My annoyance factor on this ride was essentially 1. The window issue and 2, I was SURE no tip would be included. After all I am an experienced UBER driver who has been through this crap before. Thus, I rated her a 2. UBER asks why and I just selected "other". 
You guessed it she tipped $15. I did hit the "thanks for the tip" button though.

Name: FLKeys
Story:
Weekend started off bad with my 3rd trip being and Uber Scammer. I'll post more about that in Uber Eats.

Had more cancels this past weekend than I have had so far this year.

First cancel, Friday Night, this guy was way to drunk to be getting in my car. Here is a series of screen shots from my dash cam. Easy pass, he actually fell again when he got past my front bumper giving me room to drive off. Luckily he fell away from my car.

Two more cancels Friday night where PAX texted me just before the 5 minutes was up that they were on the way. I was not in the mood to pick up people that made me wait. Waited out timer and drove off with cancel fee. Ended up calling it a night out of frustration and headed home.

Saturday started out okay. Friday's Uber Eats episode still lingering I opted not to turn eats on the rest of the weekend. Soon the cancels started rolling in. 6 for the day, 3 PAX cancelled as I arrived at pick-up point, 2 I cancelled for No Show. The final cancel was this little peach. Hard to see her in the picture, boy friend is leaning over her as she is puking out her guts. Good Bye, let someone else deal with that.




Last trip Saturday night, pick-up at a wedding property and take a couple to their resort. They were discussing that they need to leave at 8:00 AM to get to the airport on time. Non eventful 3 mile trip. I head toward my next pick-up and see flashing lights in my mirror for a brief second. Than nothing. Get to my pick-up and the guy gets in and says hey someone left their phone. Damn, bet that was the flashing light I saw. Drop them off pretty close to resort I dropped last couple off at. Select found item option and previous trip. Used call PAX option and sure enough it was his phone as it started ringing. Went by their cottage at the resort and knocked on door. No answer. Oh well, left a note on their door to contact Uber. Turned phone off and put it in an electronics bag so they could not track it to my house.

Get up early Sunday looking for an airport trip or two. Get a ping that just looks funny, no addresses that I recognize. I accept and start to get ready to walk out the door. I get a text message saying please call me. I call PAX and he tells me where he is at. He wants me to come pick him up some 40 miles away an take him to Aventura some 120 miles away. He proceeds to tell me the app keeps telling him no drivers available where he is at so he kept randomly putting in trips. I tell him I can't drive 40 miles un paid for a trip that will take me 80 miles from where I live. He says tell me what address to put in that is close to where I am at and he will put in a multi stop trip to come get him, take him to Aventura and he will take care of my return miles. A couple of minutes later I get pick-up updated so I continue out the door. Trip started 1 minute from my house, to 40 miles south for first stop.

I was passing the resort from PAX that left phone in my car so I stopped and knocked on door again. I also had already turned the phone back on to see if they would try and call it. My note was still there, and I knew they were planning on leaving in about an hour and I would be on a long trip and not able to return the phone. No answer. Oh well, off I go to pick-up my PAX. About 10 minutes away from my pick-up the left phone rings. I answer it and pretty much tell the guy he is out of luck as I was on a long trip. Told him I would ask my PAX I was picking up if they minded if I stopped to drop the phone off. Told him to call back in 15 minutes.

Get to the stop and a guy comes out and says he needs a few minutes and says thanks for going out of your way and slips me some cash. I ask him if he was okay with me dropping of the phone, he was sure that is fine. I look at the cash he hands me, a very, very, generous tip. As I'm waiting at his Ocean front house I notice the multiple high end cars, couple of antique jeeps, 2 sizeable boats, 6 wave runners, and two crotch rockets. Man this guy is not hurting for cash at all. A few minutes later he comes out with a piece of eye candy in a tight little dress. Some back and forth conversation and he gives her an envelope. Does not take long to figure out he is a pay to play type guy. Lady gets in my car and has a very quite voice with a unique accent. He is staying, she is going with me, he thanks me again. She makes a phone call and I realize she is speaking Russian. Next thing I know she is laying down in my back seat.

Other guys phone rings, and I arrange for him to be standing on the side of the road so I can just pull over and hand him the phone. 30 minutes later I get to point he is standing there and I hand him the phone and he hands me $60. He looks at my PAX in the back seat, gets a shocked look and then laughs. I look back and her dress has rode up and her ass is just hanging out. Yep, you guessed it, no panties. She is sound a sleep.

Here is a not so revealing picture after she rolled over and kind of fixed herself. Ended up dropping her off outside Trump International Beach Resort where her ,I'm guessing, pimp was standing outside a Cadillac Escalade waiting for her.




Couple more no show cancels Sunday, and no more adventurous pick-ups.

Name: Ian Richard Markham
Story: Only mentioning this because I just now retrieved it from my mailbox and votes were required to have been cast by May 9th. Doesn’t Uber understand though that I rarely access my mailbox and only really take action on something after I’ve received my third iOS push alert?

Name: Daves0077
Story: I had a rider who was a driver in Saudi Arabia. He told me when Uber came there the country told Uber in order to operate they would be required to pay drivers 2/3 of every fare. He told me the drivers make out pretty good.

Name: kdyrpr
Story:
I gave a ride to an attractive women with her child, maybe 5 miles away. The neighborhood of the pickup was in a depressed area of town. It was obvious to me when she got into the car that she knew NO English. I mean nothing. No problem. We're on our way.
When I pulled up to the address of the drop-off she started to hand me a $50 dollar bill! I thought she was giving me a tip.
I told her that was too much. I assumed she wasn't aware of the currency and exactly how much she was giving me, so I refused.
I then deduced based on some hand gestures toward the app that she thought she had to pay for the ride.
I gave the the OK sign and told her everything was paid. I did not take the $50.
Don't regret it.
BTW: Her looks had nothing to do with it. 

What would you do?

Name: MissAnne
Story: Well, clumsy Anne strikes again. Was picking my dog up from the vet, it was pouring down rain, so we were running to the car, and my dog got between my legs and down I went, hit my head and fractured the ball joint in my upper arm and dislocated my shoulder... The entire left side of my body is one big giant bruise. No driving for at least 6-8 weeks.

Name: OCJarvis
Story:
I'm absolutely ruthless, until I'm not.

Because in the end I'm just a big old softie

Name: Young Kim
Story: Had a young lady pax so uber vegan, that I was struck by her passion. As we drove, she outlined how she first became vegan after watching the movie "Earthlings 2005". It is a movie about how animals are treated before they become meat for the population. It is narrated by Joaquin Phoenix. After the ride, I did watch just the preview on YouTube, and I actually shed tears (I never before shed a tear watching just a movie preview). I often like to ask a passenger who I made a solid connection with, "What are you most passionate about in life?" She answered with emotion...this particular pax was on a mission to turn everyone she knew to understand how animals suffer before they make it to our dinner plates. I was awestruck by her emotion and persuasion. I've met many vegetarians before, but often they were for religious reasons. This is one of the first who went all out vegan after seeing a movie and then doing her own studies. She told me that she feels that while it may take a long time,future unborn people on Earth will one day look upon present day humans with harsh feelings about how our society consumes meat on a mass scale (knowing how they were treated).

Name: Juggalo9er
Story: On mackinaw Island.... turns out cars are prohibited...damn surge

Name: FormerTaxiDriver♧
Story:
Last week, I was called to a house that had two young women going to work in separate parts of town. The mother called me directly, while ordering an Uber for the other.

Upon arrival, I seen a shiny grey Ford sitting in a dark cul-de-sac SHUFFLING! Yes, thats right in the very act of stealing money! I went up to the front door area, with my cab, and blew the horn. All three women came out.

The mom was holding her phone while looking waaaaay over at the corner and caught her Uber in the act!

Name: draboo
Story: The Uber Tip stars were aligned last night.I picked up 5 drunks in my XL near Myrtle Beach. Dropped them off and one of them went to tip me and his wallet was missing. He jumps back in and asks me tot take him to a local bar. I reluctantly agree, cause it's not that far away. He goes in and looks for wallet, with no luck. Climbs back in and we go a quarter mile and he finds it in his pocket, Embarrassed, he tips me $100. Cool. I have a ride in que, so I go to drop him off, and all his buddies clamber back in the van and insist I take them to MickyDs. I say no, but a different dude hands me $50 bill. I say, ok. Let the que wait. 4 miles later we pickup a bag full of burgers, and I inform the crew, that there will be NO EATING in my van. They pitch a fit and whine and offer me another $50 for my permission to eat. I again cave and bring them 4 miles back to the hotel. 50 minutes/ 200 tip/31 fare.

Name: Erik M
Story: I would never try to give any type of compliments to Gryft or Duber considering how they F'd us w/o lube over serge and destination perks. I drove yesterday and today (Fri/Sat) and noticed the small serge amounts they share with us is significantly higher then the past few weeks since they rolled out the new serge crap, especially on Gryft. They were offering $25 power zones on all of my rides I took in Orange County when I got back from driving in LA. I absolutely hate short rides but was welcoming the jackass pax's that were going 4 blocks. I made a cool $125 in about 55 mins from 5 back to back rides on Gryft between 9pm-10pm Sat night. I hadn't actually seen the power zones in months so it was a surprise to see them at such high amounts. I even took a Gryft ride from LAX to Fountain Valley with a $28 bonus. Dubers serges were ranging between $10-$30 in O.C. Sat night. I also noticed that Duber is again putting the Long Ride 45min message back on. From Fri/Sat night working from 5-10pm each night I cleared just short of $500! Maybe that $200 million Duber/Gryft is spending on bonuses to retain drivers I keep hearing about on the news is finally trickling down to the drivers!

Name: Tiktak
Story:
I have noticed DiDi often pays you less than Uber. I think in longer run you’re better off with Uber considering it’s pick ups are close by.

Opinions?

Name: Fusion_LUser
Story:
Is that you ?

 has been pretty quiet... 🤣 🤣 🤣

Name: The Gift of Fish
Story:
I recently had an interview for a driving job. One of the questions posed by the interviewer was:

"At a junction with a four way stop sign, four cars arrive at their respective stop signs at the same time. Who has the right of way."

"Nobody", I replied

"Incorrect", replied the interviewer. "The correct answer is the driver to your right.

"Incorrect", I replied. "If four cars arrive at the same time, then each car is to the right of another driver, meaning that all cars have right of way which, in turn, means that none of them does - none would have more right than any of the three drivers do.

"That's what the California drivers' handbook says", said the interviewer.

"Then, in this case, the handbook is wrong", I replied.

When I arrive at the same time as another vehicle at a multi-way stop sign:

- If the other driver is in a BMW or Audi, then the driver will believe (s)he automatically goes first, so I just let them.

- Any other driver, they will usually hesitate and dawdle, resulting in a Mexican standoff. I hit the gas and go.

What do you do?

Name: Sonoran Uber
Story: Our most recent data indicates that 40-60% of pages for pick up are going unfulfilled & it is most probably higher on the higher end rides.

Name: #1husler
Story:
Yesterday yours truly encountered a "one minute wonder" (actually, less than a min) ride with a pax going 3 city blocks (less than a half mile). 

It was in a decent neighborhood, in broad day light and in perfect spring/summer weather to boot.. seemed an excellent day for short 5 -10 min walk...so what gives I wondered?

Me: Ok, I see...we're going around the corner there?

Pax: I know, its only 3 blocks, but I didn't feel like walking home from work today

Me: Oh cool. Do you usually "Uber" because home and work then?

Pax: Not always, I walked to work this morning, but I just feel too lazy to do it this afternoon, so....

I've seen this before...last weekend it was somewhat similar...I picked up a couple on a lovely warm, sunny afternoon, they were grousing about having to wait more than an hour for their PU (because of the driver shortage), so I said I'd shave a few mins off their ride...only to slide and see that the ride was only a min, around the corner to the bar. 

Both these ride were fine with me...because this PUs were each only like 3 mins away from me and I was chasing down promos on them (I knocked out these rides in under 5 mins total)....but aside from that it seems a waste during an "Uber shortage" to take lazy pax 3 blocks down the road to get a beer while others need to go to the airport, etc., and are getting a "no car available" response...I'm wondering if Uber would hike minimum fares (AND share it with drivers) during this so-called "driver shortage" to better utilize drivers.

Name: Classical Telecaster
Story:
Got a ping to Walmart. Fine. The pax was identified as Heather. As is my practice I positioned myself between the main and secondary entrances with my rear view mirror on the secondary entrance. 

In the rear view mirror I see a large, filthy fellow eyeing my car. He didn’t look like a Heather to me. He keeps looking at his phone, then my distinctive car with vanity plate, then back to his phone. 

The timer creeps into the charging passenger for wait zone while big greasy Heather keeps eyeing my car. As the timer crosses past four minutes, I see big greasy Heather type something into his phone and my phone pings “Walmart”. 

I reply with the single keystroke “I arrived”. 

Big greasy Heather types furiously and my phone pings “No you aren’t. Walmart!” 

Timer hits 5:00. Cancel. No show. $4.85 cancellation fee paid. 

I got rhythm. I got music.

Name: Young Kim
Story:
Had a pax who was just working now at a restaurant who decided that for himself it made no sense to go to college until he could get the "full college experience". He was such a friendly guy and we discussed how going to school now would not allow him any decent experiences. He said that friends ahead of him in college have all remote learning and cannot attend classes or socialize (like going to sports games, clubs, bars, study halls). So he said that he will postpone entering school until he can really have all the experiences he wanted. 

I thought that was problably the best choice. I told him that it was likely the right decision, as college happens only once in your life, and going now may not be the best decision, especially because the cost of college is so great. He told me that a freshman at U. of Dayton pays $40,000/year in tuition alone. We agreed that for that massive of a sum, it is worth it to wait.

Name: Erik M
Story: I came across this article in The Guardian. The Media is finally writing an article against Uber instead of always writing articles on their behalf about how they're spending millions on driver bonuses to bring in new drivers. In reality, they're not spending a dime to retain their current drivers.

Name: Classical Telecaster
Story:
The general Asheville populace loves to hoard. A rumor of snow triggers mass purchases of milk and toilet paper. Most store shelves go bare of the essentials. 

Well, with the gas pipeline ransom ware, guess what? Lines down the block with a half dozen stations already out of gas. 

This will keep even more RS drivers off of the road. Assuming I can get gas, it should be a good week.

Name: Guido-TheKillerPimp
Story:
Not of wildlife, mind you, but of premium rides. Today was another example of $0.00 from either app, and $400 ca$h in my pocket. 
Nice long return ride with a pax I gladly poached from Uber. Nothing better than beating them at their own game. 😎

Name: The Gift of Fish
Story:
Time for another What Would You Do poll. It was Tuesday night and business was very slow in SF when I got a ping from the airport, 9 miles away from my location. Uber was offering $55 for a 49 mile ride east. 100 miles total and around 2 hours, and gas for the trip would cost around 9 bucks, so $23 revenue per hour after gas. Way below target earnings, but it would be an easy freeway ride and the city was as quiet as underwater flatulence, so I accepted.

Then the message came in from the pax:







Pax tells me she is at the terminal. I tell pax that I cannot pick up from the terminals. Pax replies that she will go to a different terminal. 'Cause if the driver says that he can't pick up from the terminals, only from the designated pickup area, it does of course make sense to suggest a different terminal to be picked up from. Because who knows where the pickup area is. Shoot me now.

By this point the pax had confirmed herself as a fully-fledged moron. Your choices as a driver are:

1) Try to give pax step-by-step instructions on how to find the pickup area. (a) Look for the signs, (b) walk in direction indicated by signs, (c) stop walking when pickup area is reached. The moron is strong in this pax; chance of success: 10%

2) Do an illegal pickup at the terminal where the pax is. Chance of success: 80%. Chance of $100 ticket from airport cops: 20-40%.

3) Drive to pickup area, wait 5:00 and then no show pax. Drive to airport was 9 miles; no show fee will be around 9 bucks. Chance of success: 100%

What would you do?

Name: Halfmybrain
Story:
This man has been a member of Chicago's Uber & Lyft Facebook group since April 21, 2017.

Here's the only video that shows someone offer him a $5000 gift:


This has two local news reports, one the morning after (I think he spent the night at the hospital), and one some days later.

Name: Erik M
Story: Lyft had ripped me off on a cancelation fee on Jan 26th so angered, I wrote the following post(attached) to their Facebook page on January 27th and it was shared over 100 times. On Feburary 16th, I received this email from Lyft stating they were changing my rates to a lower amount. It stats that my rates were a little higher then some other drivers and now they were lowering them to the attached following rates. Coincidence, perhaps, but the timing is extremely convenient since 2 weeks prior I wrote the rant on their Facebook page! I didn't see the email until yesterday when I was cleaning out my inbox and came across it. I rarely drive for Lyft, actually i hadn't driven for them since they burned me on the fee which incentivised me to write the rant on their FB page but I feel it's proof that Lyft retaliated against me and I plan to bring Arbitration against them for this.

Name: EM1
Story:
Youre all liars-Uber says youre making bank & doing fine. 

Ok Im sure some drivers doing well but I’d say the overwhelming majority of drivers are not & would prefer multiplier return. Not just more money but also more control.

Name: Omega 3
Story: Who was the "Get out of my car!" Uber guy? Did he do any interviews? Did he get deactivated? I am totally on his side.

Name: ftupelo
Story:
Howdy all you Ants! On this episode of I'd like to discuss the proper construction of your retirement portfolio. Since UBER does not provide us with 401k's, it is incumbent upon ourselves to construct a retirement plan that fits our needs. Now, I am not a certified financial planner (no CFP designation), but I am an expert in the fields of finance and investing.  That said, I can provide the board with my approach to investing, which may work for some, but everyone should do their own research and construct a plan that works for them and helps them achieve their goals, all within the confines of their own personal risk appetite.

Most importantly, and regardless of how you choose to invest your savings, an ant  save. Various sources will advocate setting aside different percentages of your income in savings. Taking that approach is fine, but I save as much as humanly possible and likely well above the suggested percentages. We  get in the mindset that money is not just a means of exchange, it is an asset that can be deployed to earn its own return. We  understand the wonders of compounding and how important it is to initiate this plan as early as possible in one's career. IRA's can be a useful vehicle to start saving for many of us. However, some of us will not be able to utilize this structure if you and your old lady make more than $200k annually.

Once the ant has decided to start saving and picked their desired vehicle, they must decide how they wish to allocate their capital. I am personally a fan of the endowment model popularized by David Swensen while at Yale. The problem for most is that it takes a sizeable capital base to be able to deploy this strategy. Fear not, one can take a modified approach to attempt to match the returns and volatility profile of the endowment model - something Frankie-T calls the modified endowment model.

Public equities and bonds should be the cornerstone of every ant's portfolio. I personally use Vanguard ETF's to achieve the desired exposure for very low fees - fees are, in this day and age, an unnecessary drag on portfolio returns. In this bucket, beyond your traditional S&P 500 type equities and treasuries or corporate bonds funds, you may want to include ETF's that have exposure to emerging markets, commodities, REITS, Collateralized Mortgage Backed Securities, BDC's, or other assets with solid yields. However, we must keep in my that dividends are taxed when distributed, so this approach may not be the best for folks in high tax brackets. Tax efficiencies are an often overlooked aspect of portfolio construction.

I addition to these staples, I like to add in more esoteric assets in order to mimic the endowment model. Some of the easiest ways to get these exposures are to purchase a home, which should increase in value, rental properties, cryptoassets (which includes owning, mining, running masternodes, and staking), precious metals, and music royalties. I like to create a bucket for these alternative assets and then distribute this bucket into these other assets mentioned. The goal of this approach is to diversify assets, minimize correlations, minimize volatility, provide some passive income through yield and dividends, and achieve returns in most market conditions. Unfortunately, most of us will not have access to LP investments in funds in private equity, venture capital or hedge funds - however, the right mix of investments can give you similar returns.

I think this is a good start as a primer on retirement investing, however, I would like to open it up to the ants to suggest other favorite investments or investment strategies. We are always interested in trying to achieve outsized returns and I believe the collective wisdom of the crowds is the best approach to trying to do so.

Thank you and toodles,

Frankie

Name: dilldog05
Story: I read on here that instead of getting holiday back pay that we are legally entitled to, all the way back to 2016 or when you started since 2016, Uber are only paying the last two years. Well after 16 emails and Ankura who are dealing with the claims, dodging the question completely, I can confirm, that it’s correct. Just the last 2 years. Which obviously dodges the bulk of compensation, as because of COVID-19, most of us earned considerably less than previous years. New it was too good to be true. What a disgrace!!!!

Name: Ziggywaz
Story: Who decided that when the police dept. Gets a call for a domestic violence issue that in order to deescalate the problem they offer the offender a choice. You can go to jail OR call an Uber and remove yourself from the situation. This happened to me. I don't want that raving lunatic in my car.. they are usually drunk and very unpredictable. It seems as though the police just want to make their problem my problem.

Name: AB5
Story: Stop being surfs!!!

Name: Karen Stein
Story:
Where to begin? This tale has more twists than a drunk python.

March 9: On my own time I get hit, car totaled, I’m as pure as fresh snow.
March 13: Purchase new Corolla Hatchback. Resume rideshare.
April 17: Rear ended while driving at speed. Customer fine. Report accident to Uber. I was no more at fault, nor could I have avoided this, had a falling Russian satellite landed on me.
April 19: Allstate (Ubers insurance) says they’re not paying. My insurer sets me up with a rental.
April 20: Shop tells me car is totaled.
April 22: Pick up new car. Return rental.
April 23: Shop calls. Have parts ordered and will fix car.
OMG
So ... now I own TWO new cars. Once repairs are completed, I get to sell one — after I pay off the note! Ugh.
I can’t wait to see what happens next.

Name: Guido-TheKillerPimp
Story:
Ping from "Terry"
Arrive at dental office.
OMG, Terry is a late 60's early 70's transvestite in full drag. Skirt, heels, boobs, earings, make-up....the whole 9 yards. 
Terry is also still feelings the effects laughing gas.
If I had my gun, I just may have ended my misery on the spot.
The longest 5 miles of my life!

Name: NorthNJLyftacular
Story:
I got a request this morning around 4 am. 
100% PT. A few minutes into my drive to the pick up I get a call.

" Hi, is this Lyft? You're going to be picking up my aunt and [someone else] to bring them to the hospital for an OPERATION. I need you to go to the door and make sure they get up. Bang on the doors and windows"
"I'm sorry, I'm not gonna do that"
"But what if they don't come out? I'm still gonna have to pay?"
(Not to mention, the freaking OPERATION, for dear auntie)
"Well, I'll wait for 5 minutes then you'll be charged a $5 cancellation fee". 
"I don't want that"
"You're welcome to cancel, maybe the next driver will do it". 
"Ok"

I lost the 100% but I was cracking up. It's a joke what these people expect us to do! Also, the fact that some random Lyft driver was apparently a key part of her plan to get a relative to an operation? Wtf?!

Name: Cvillegordo
Story:
The 1st time this happened to me I thought it was coincidence; now I'm positive that it is a deliberate revenge tactic done by groups of students such as sororities or fraternities.

Went to a pickup at a restaurant, a large group of girls, four came to my car, I patiently explained the rule of 3. Some mild arguing ensued but they were mostly polite, after a quick huddle 3 of them hopped in for the short ride back to their sorority. There was some furtive whispering going on but this happens a lot, they are barely old enough to drink (or have fake id's) after all, so I ignored it. Dropped off, exaggerated "thank you!" from the girls, off they skipped. No, really; one of them actually skipped! 

I turned around left the parking lot got 3 blocks away: "ping!" Pickup location is.... the place I just left. Different requestor. 
U-turn, back to the parking lot and....canceled by rider within one minute. I turn around and again get just a couple blocks away; ping! Same thing again, different name. Return, this one also cancels. This time I stayed in the parking lot, and the same trick was repeated three more times. I could see a group of people huddled at the big window in front, pretty sure they were enjoying their little game. Or maybe they were just doing jello shots out of each other's belly buttons, I don't know. I called support and told them what was going on, they said that intentional harassment of drivers or passengers in any form was against the rules, could have serious consequences blah, blah blah.
Pretty hard to prove anything.

Name: BigBadBob
Story:
What is the difference between an uber pax and a canoe?
Sometimes the canoe tips

Name: _Tron_
Story:
We all know what the first thing is. Raise pay, including base rates and restore surges.

Second thing would have to be no deactivation without due process.

What about after that? For me the third thing would be to allow all drivers to drive in any state/province of their said country. I would love to have the freedom to take a cross-country trip and pick up pax along the way. But noooooooo. We can't do that. As CEO I would find a way to make that work. If a driver must meet certain requirements before driving in a particular state or city, then a team would expedite that process. No more than a one hour wait to get bonafide for where you want to drive.

What is your list?

Name: ubermikeo
Story:
Tuesday morning I had arrived at a Trucking place for my first ride of the day.
Guy flags me down as I pull into yard. He then proceeds to put several bags in the trunk.

This big man and a big woman get in my car for a short ride to a hotel several miles away.
Casual conversation about the weather. He says they are from Florida.

I stop at the door and pop the trunk and get out and watch as he loads his stuff on a cart.

Pax- I saw you looking at my woman.
Me- (Totally shocked) What?
Pax- Yea I seen you looking at my woman.
Me- I was not looking at your woman.
Pax-God tells me things. He told me you were looking at my woman.
Me-(wtf?) I got a woman.

I hopped in my car and got the heck outta there lickity-splitly.

Later I told my GF about she thought it was funny.
I was not the least bit looking at his woman nor would I ever.

Name: #1husler
Story:
Yesterday yours truly received the attached ride request (my longest ever) to go from Tucson to Savannah, Georgia..almost 2,000 miles/28 hours away. That beats my usual +45 rides, gunning it 90 mins up to Phoenix.

I told pax that I (regrettably) couldn't take her to Georgia because I had work in the morning....but offered to take her to Tucson International Airport for a flight...at which point I realized she didn't speak English (or have any travel luggage for that matter) so it was probably a mistake....but maybe not, who knows right? 

If I had taken her up on that offer, then what happens?, does Uber "time out" the ride after like 12 hours and I'm kinda out in the wilderness on my own? Or do I need to call Rohit and give a "heads up" that I'm gonna haul a pax across the US?

Anyone?...

Name: Classical Telecaster
Story:
Was just about to knock off for the night when I got a ping about five blocks from my house. Usually rides at this hour from this part of town is a couple running downtown for drinks. Call it a quick $7 and still five minutes from home. 

Not this time. I cannot make it up the potholed two track driveway. I am about to throw it in reverse and hit cancel when this rough looking country “boy” (looked about 70 to me) comes running up. 

“Hold on, just got to grab my stuff.”

“What stuff.”

“Well, my clothes, a cooler and...my service dog.”

Sh!t. Can’t cancel now. No way that fat beast was a service dog, but I was not going to risk deactivation. 

Turns out to be a twenty mile ride to the best ginseng poaching area in the next county. 

Got in a lot later than I hoped. Oh, the stories he told.

Name: The Gift of Fish
Story: What are your signs that you're done for the night?

Name: EM1
Story: So for fun/curiosity I turned on the uber app just now. Get back-to-back pings, each paxil was 20 miles away. One was a 1/2 mile ride. Thats like 6 blocks. With a $4 sticky surge it was still like a $7 fare. I whispered in full cinco de mayo spirit ‘no gracias’, declined the pings & opened a bottle of red wine.

Name: kingcorey321
Story:
So i have about 3000 delivers completed with food .
I got my first negative comment today.
Diner . Sir do you think its professional to take your dog with you wile delivering food ?
Me . Yes that dog is a service animal . Me what is the problem ?
Diner .There is a hair on the top of my glass !
Me ok hand it back . I will give you a full refund .
Diner . No that is not good enough !
Me go have a great day .I will Grub Hub myself . Miss its a service animal . It has to go everywhere i go .
Diner BLA BLA BLA and BLA BLA BLA. She starts to cuss .
Me i walk off. I call support .
Support agent could not understand what the deal with the diner . Support agent sounds pissed at the diner for being a total B.....h
Support agent said do not worry you can bring a service animal anywhere i go .
It is not a violation to being a service animal to work with you . Support said she should of gave the drink back to me for a refund .
Blow the damn hair off big deal , Its on the top of a sealed cup . Karma may get her in the future with the same stupidity she showed me .
I though i share this story. Happy to say Gh had my back .
Dog in the car or not . I have dog hair on my shirt jacket seats . It very well could of blown onto the cup. It was very windy today. If it was a dog hair and not a person hair from the restaurant ?

Name: MyJessicaLS430
Story:
Yesterday afternoon, I drove back home during lunch break. Ahead of me was a brand new ES with a temporary plate whose driver was waiting for somebody to open the building main gate. Obviously the driver doesn't live here as he walked toward me and signalled that he was picking up somebody. He is an older gentleman in the late 50s and politely asked if I could buzz him in. Sure. I needed to get inside too 🤣 . 

The first thing I realized is his hat that reads US Marine. Out of curiosity, I asked whether he was still actively serving (may be a position of command, intelligence or training the newly recruits, etc). By the time I entered the passcode, he said he no longer served and was no different than any other citizen. Then I thought we would part our ways after a simply reply with "Oh, I see". When I was about to leave, the same car was still parking by the garage gate with hazard lights on. I then offered to open the garage gate beside the main gate such that he could wait inside the building. He said "That is sweet of you but I don't know which floor my  lives".

Wait a second, did he say ? "Sorry, by any chance are you driving Uber or Lyft?", I asked. Later, he told me that it was the second week doing rideshare as a means of distraction from the pain of losing his daughter to TNBC (triple negative breast cancer). "I am so sorry for the loss, I know how hard it is to accept the reality of tested negative for all the receptors". Before I answered his question about my background, I thought it was far more important for him to learn how not to be taken advantage of. "Sir, I know this is not my business but I think you should shuffle and move on. It has already been almost 15 minutes since we first met. You should have cancelled the ride". Personally I despise any behaviours that abuses the older generations. Unlike the cunning, deceitful and entitled youth, the elder adults are honest and hard-working humans. They don't deserve to be treated like this. 

After leaving him confused, I disclose that I am a former driver. This just gets to my nerves how his kindness is abused. I left him my contact if he wanted a rideshare 101. Yes, that may sound ignorant to be rideshare mentor as I am nowhere close to how experienced most are on this forum but again, he deserves better than this. At this paltry rate, these low-lives do not deserve a brand new vehicle, not to mention a Lexus. "Allow me to be blunt but you are not going to make money. You are basically giving people free rides". Although I realize that this is just an activity to keep him occupied, it doesn't make any financial sense in any part.

Name: tohunt4me
Story: Driver has Decided to stay away from Uber, because Driving Uber is Not worth Risking his Life !

Name: mark813
Story:
I am a good judge of people though every once and a while they surprise me. I tell my son to never judge someone and the occasional passenger always reminds me. 
Someone that appears to be well off and says they will tip in advance for you going out of your way somehow never does,.
Then on the other hand there is the hard worker you pick up making min wage and you do your job driving them home only to be left a $5.00 tip on multiple occasions.. 
I dont thing the response saying "says thanks for the tip" is enough on the app So I would like to take the time and say Thank You! I wish the app would let you type a message.

Name: AveragePerson
Story:
You were laughing when Uber IPO tanked but now even if they are bleeding millions all day long, Uber is getting more valuable. Lower fare = more earnings! Get with the times, people!

$110Billion+!
$110,000,000,000+!

Name: mthom
Story: If this isn't new, I've never noticed it before. Uber looks to be trying to entice us into waiting on scheduled trips here in Nashville now. Had this pop up when I was canceling a ride when I'd have had to wait 20 minutes.

Name: Benjamin M
Story:
, this one's for you. ♥ 

Things have been crappy over the past two years for all of us. Lots of concerns regarding health and maybe even losing loved ones. This gig has been unpredictable and more stressful. 



I gained a great friend, a local driver. I have enjoyed our almost daily conversations over several months, sharing our good and bad stories and helping each other out. 

I am thankful for starting a plan toward improving myself (physically, mentally, and financially) and my family helping my wife and I to find a new home. 

I am thankful for the fact that RS and delivery has kept me occupied during this mess and has been mostly profitable. And for this gig getting me out and earning in the first place when I really had no path in sight (next to nothing to $38k). 

Please try to share something positive.  will appreciate that the local driver (name yourself) is likely tired of my endless *****ing. 😂

Name: Jimmy44
Story:
After over a year off I returned to driving today.
Worked from 3 to 6:30 and took 10 rides. 
The most difficult thing was wearing the mask. I am always aware of it and it fogs up my tinted cheaters.
It's a small sample but I found riders to be a little more appreciative. 
There are more promotions then there were March 2020.
Uber kept my Diamond rating which I will keep until July.
Because Uber needs drivers desperately the entire app is shall I say driver friendly.

Name: Cvillegordo
Story: So yesterday I gave Katie Boulter and her coach a ride to their hotel after her match. (She won her first two matches.) What a gorgeous- and very sweet- girl!! Her coach is from Spain. Here's a photo! Loving the gig this week.

Name: FLKeys
Story:
Got a counterfeit $5.00 bill last night as a tip. It was a bad attempt. Came from a bartender that I took home. When they handed it to me it felt funny and I looked at it a little later when I had better light. I wrote in black sharpie on it thanks for the fake tip, took it back to their house and taped it to the door.

Probably get deactivated today when they complain to Uber that I came back to their house.

Name: UE for life
Story: I tried a new plan, no orders below $10. Why are all apartments gated? The code never works. I'm making $25/hour now. I have not had an apartment all week. Uber tells me u can make $30/hour, but I've never done it. I am never parked. I put 150 miles on my car each day. I'm in north Dallas, and it is lucrative. 7 a.m. to 9 p.m. each day, and i swear i am the only Uber driver out there. I see DD drivers all day long. I never see anyone working Uber. I only do Uber. Order and pay is fixed. My card was declined 50% of the time. I paid no taxes last year. The hours I work and what Uber reports are different. I am Uber Eats, no PAX, no bs. I have worked every shift, 24 hours/day. Anyone one esle know how to avoid apartments? What works for you?

Name: Aw Jeez
Story:
I read posts on this forum and I get the impression that some of you really don't this job and really don't like our customers. And I always want to ask: Why do you do this? By now, everyone should realize that Uber is not a great full-time job - if it ever was. By now, you can't exactly blame Uber for your particular situation. You've had plenty of time to re-evaluate and get out if that's what you want. And so, again I wonder: Why keep doing something you so obviously dislike?

Middle-aged couple got in the car at a hotel the other morning. Black couple but I don't think it matters. Woman asks me to pop the truck, so I do and then I hop out and help them load their numerous bags. As we leave for the short ride to the airport, I ask them about their stay and such. Just idle chit-chat. When we get to the airport, I hop out and go get one of the little baggage carts they provide. This ain't New York, it's pretty chill here and I didn't have another ride stacked.

"You're the best Uber driver ever!" the old guy goes. Which I know is not true, but he meant it sincerely. "Our last two drivers ignored us...wouldn't help with the bags, didn't talk to us...made us feel like we were imposing on him." I thanked them and wished them a pleasant trip home. By the time I was out of the airport, I saw the $10 tip on top of the $5.71 fare.

Look, this job really isn't that hard or that bad. Just be nice to people...treat them like human beings, not some big inconvenience or annoyance. If you don't like people, perhaps ride-sharing is not the field for you. If you're not making enough money doing ride-share, perhaps it's not the field for you. And if you resent passengers for not living up to your expectations at the beginning, middle or end of the ride, perhaps ride-share is not the field for you.

Me, I happen to love this job! Every day, I thank God that Uber came along and got me out of driving a taxi (which was okay but a lot more work for the money). I've had a lot of fun jobs...but mainly I've been a helicopter pilot most of my life, and doing  job is the most fun I've ever had. No, I'm not getting rich, and I'm putting about 30,000/year on the car, which is fine. Uber/Lyft gives me about $2,400 - $2,500 per month in my bank account. I could make more if I wanted to work harder, but I don't.

Some of you guys really need an attitude check. The passengers are not your enemy. I wish some drivers would stop treating them as though they are. It makes it hard for the rest of us.

Name: FLKeys
Story:
Get a ping for a gated community on Saturday. Right away send message asking for gate code. (I am now keeping a list) No response from PAX. I was only a minute away and am now at the gate. I call the PAX and he answers. I say Hi, this is FL Keys from Uber I'm at the gate and need a gate code. He acts all stupid and says he has no idea what I am talking about, he didn't order a ride, and he is not sure he even has Uber on his phone. I say is XXX your address and he says yes. I say well someone used your phone to order a ride you need to go in the app and cancel it if you don't want it. He barks back I don't have the app on my phone and he is going to end the call. I hear a beep and think he ends the call. I go to cancel and I hear in the back ground that he is yelling at someone for ordering a ride too soon.

At that point I say screw it I need a break and gas anyway I'll leave the ride open and wait for him to cancel.

I go get gas, go to a fast food place and use the facility, BS with the manager a few minutes, fill my water cup and head out back on the road. See the ride is still active on my phone. Decide to drive by the place and a car is pulling out so I sneak through the gate. I get close enough to the house to start the timer counting down. Around the 4 minute mark I see another Uber/Lyft car pull up to the house. Pick the PAX up and head off. 

Finally 5 minutes is up and I cancel for No Show. I was surprised to see the no show fee come up as $13.58

Nice little paid break.

Name: ozzyoz7
Story:
This time baby I'll be Bulletproof.


I myself was assaulted by a young college student drunk girl. I dropped her boyfriend off anf they were repeat customers of mine and they always got matched up with me when I was nearby. All of a sudden as we were driving at night in the rich Edina homes area, she grabs me from behind my seat and she isn't aware she is choking me and I can't even talk while at same time she pressed her face with smelly melted makeup hard against my cheek as she says "I hope you get mad p**** tonight" and i tried removing her arm off my adams apple as she was constricting my airflow and me blacking out means we will end up crashing into some million dollar home.

The fight or flight adrenaline rush kicked in and I had to go SSJ2 with more blood flow to my muscles just to get her large arm off of me. I thought to myself is this German genetics or were womem always this strong?.

I spared her of calling police on her as I didn't wanna ruin her future with a criminal record because she was drunk and didn't know she was endangering myself and herself and stuff outside the car in event of accident. I warned her but with her drunkenness, she didn't even listen to me. 

In another incident an upscale looking man with golf shirt tucked in and looking like a father of your average college students. When we got on the freeway he asks me if I am sending the drug dealers to assassinate him. I offered to kick him out but he apologized so I dropped him off anyways. He was maybe methhead.

In another case in an upscale condo ping, I picked up an Engineer who looked like a young Robert Redford, and we had a couple stops 1 being the gas station and other being his girlfriend house.

When we got to his girlfriend house and parked right in front of it on street where she can even see us if so she checked her large house windows, I noticed the guy wasn't getting out then after a while he asks me "Can I ask you something (fill in my name here)" then I replied "man it doesn't sound good if you have to ask me if it's ok if you wanna ask me something".

Then he says, "Can I suck your D quick"? Where D is you know what. I then replied "your girlfriend house is right there and can see us" then he asks again and I reply can you just go to your girlfriend? Then he asks again and I start opening my door and he gets scared and exists finally. 

All these incidents are just with 4k rides I had. There are tons of drivers with 20k rides. Imagine what they have seen and experienced. 

When I come back to Uber driving I will so get custom aftermarket bp glass shielding around my car seat separating me from front and rear sitting Pax. No law against it. Plus shootings happen in twin cities where I drove.

It's a crazy workd out there. You guy remember what that Walmart girl did to that Uber driver when she slashed him up to death.

Back to that girl who choked me, in the days following her assault, I noticed increased fat burning and more muscle definition on myself and thought to myself "I think the body thinks theres danger nearby always now that I survived that incident and body is favouring fitness now for survival lol"

Name: rich5371
Story:
Last night I picked up a passenger from a Hospital Emergency Room entrance; he was escorted out by a big burly sheriff's deputy and two hospital orderlies (big men). The passenger was behaving a bit odd from the start and I didn't feel good about taking him, but I didn't feel like I could ask him to get out of the car at that point. Big lesson learned.
His destination was 9 miles away, and he was bouncing off the sides of the vehicle the whole way, throwing trash out the window, sounding like he was gagging and possibly spitting, I just held my breadth and told myself we would be at the destination and it would be over soon. We got to the destination and he was laying down on the floor across the passenger and driver area, and he would not get out of the car. After nearly 10 minutes I had no choice but to call 911. He started spitting at things all over the car, bringing up mucus and real nasty spit. After 20 minutes of waiting, he started to make like a tent in the back seat with his shirt, and I'd had enough. I opened up the back door again and told him that was it, he had to get out of my vehicle. He lunged up between the seats into the front, grabbed my bag of personal items and my cell phone and tried to get away. I body slammed him back and he dropped the phone and bag. He was pushed back into the car in that exchange, and I put my head in and convinced him if he didn't get out it would be bad for him. He opened the passenger side door, got out and walked away. As soon as he was no longer in site the Sheriff deputy showed up. I told the deputy what happened and the direction the guy left in. The glass back of my Samsung S9+ was shattered, the deputy asked if I wanted to file a report on it and I said no, not right then. Maybe later. I reached out to Uber and escalated the situation to a supervisor. They are "glad I'm not hurt", won't do anything about the spit (no pictures, I wiped the nastiness up with a towell), and offered me $15.00 for my destroyed phone. I sent pictures of the phone along with the receipt. I buy phones outright, it was $550.00. I can't press charges because I can't get the passengers information. I can only imagine one of my adult daughters being put in this situation.

Name: Legendary Status
Story: Such a beautiful woman, life gone too soon. I hope they find these killers and put them in prison for life.

Name: Erik M
Story: Got a ping tonight from San Clamente and I'm guessing they want to go to Armenia?! Either they are really dumb and don't realize there's a large body of water between us and Eastern Europe or they think Uber has those 007 cars that can turn into subs! Never the less, $4k seems kinda low to drive someone 4000 miles!!

Name: Young Kim
Story:
Just had a pax who told me the most painful reason I heard that he had to start taking an Uber. A rather young guy, in his mid 20s, coming from a friend's house. He told me that he lost his car and license in Illinois because of unpaid Illinois Tollway fines! When I asked him how much he owed, his answer shocked me. The pax said he owed over $12,000! I thought he meant $1200. But he said he just kept on ignoring the fines until the fines multiplied...all the while running even more tolls and having them multiply. I am not sure how the fines multiply, but I am guessing it was not a simple "doubling" like overdue parking tickets. He did say that he was optimistic that he could under the new Illinois law regarding tollway fines to have them significantly reduced under some pandemic assistance relief program. 

I have heard so many reasons why someone had to start taking an Uber everywhere, but this was really surprised me...

Name: Young Kim
Story:
Just dropped off a pax named Rose. Super nice and friendly. Interestingly for me, she just dropped out of law school to pursue her dreams of being an Instagram star. She told me that she is buying books and researching the topic aggressively. I showed her some of my magic tricks at the end of the Uber ride, and she encouraged me to build a social media account. I just perused some of her Instagram pics. Perhaps she has what it takes. She told me that she hated law school and found it to be super dry, boring, and tedious. I picked her up from a bar around Mount Prospect, IL.

I found it fascinating because as I wrote there seems to be a definite trend, how many young people are seeking to build a career in the world of social media. They are shunning traditional careers and trying hard to carve their own path. Many guys are trying to sell merchandise online, and produce music. Many young ladies are trying to make it in the world of fashion and cooking. She says she is actively advertising her Instagram account and trying to build up a large following. A whole bunch of them are doing loads and loads of TikTok videos. Here are a few of her pics. I can certainly tell from the efforts she has been putting into her pictures and her many many posts that she is dead serious.

Name: Benjamin M
Story:
At least here in Richmond Virginia, demand seems to be increasing. 

I've even had pax going out on the town and even a few tourists, unheard of since the beginning of the pandemic. More importantly, in the two weeks that I've been back to pax, a handful are actually tipping! 😂 

But, here's the downside. I've had ridiculously long distances to pick up pax, loads of "scheduled" trips, and TONS of dead miles / tolls. 118+ miles for about $85 has been the norm. 

Every day since I fired up X, it has been the same - start the trip, immediately bombarded with pings. Most are crap. I have to sign in again at least six times a day after getting the boot. Why? Because nobody is out driving! 

I fired up the Uber pax app yesterday, the only ants were hopelessly sitting at the airport. 

I want to see more ants. I want to make the same amount without driving way more miles than I did before. 

Nine trips on Uber left for a $120 quest left for tomorrow, then $100 for ten trips on Lyft Saturday. The money is out there.

Name: Benjamin M
Story:
So, I decided to add another accessory to my car - 




Even with pax looking at themselves in my camera, I've had - 

The final was the nail in the coffin. They immediately tipped me $9 but, had I not turned around to do my sweep (as I do with every pax with a bag), I would have picked up my next pax with a swimming pool in the back seat. 

So yes, I see you.

Name: The Gift of Fish
Story:
Last night I took a pax on a short ride of a few miles. Upon checking the back seat after he got out, I noticed that there was a liquid stain in the seat about 8 by 4 inches. There was no indication of what the liquid was. 

I got my phone out, took the pictures and then sent them in to Uber with the damage report. I then got the gloves and paper towels out and blotted and dried the stain as much as possible. A few hours later the stain had almost gone, just leaving a faint outline ring. At the end of the night I did the usual routine of Lysol and water cleaning of the seat (have to clean the entire seat base to not leave water stains). It took about 10 minutes to clean.

Anyway, I though that Uber would give me 20 bucks. The next morning they emailed me to tell me that they had charged the pax $150. In contrast to Uber's lowball cleaning fees of late (I recently got just 40 bucks for puke on the car), $150 was too much for this stain. 

What would you do?

Name: Benjamin M
Story:
Already depressed, stressed out, and getting fatigued running all over the place for awful pings (ENDLESS after starting a trip), I accepted a ping 16 minutes away back downtown from far south in a bad area. At least it would get me back to the city. The ping only said "premium pickup possible" with a $2 surge.

Driving there, I saw that it was a hospital pick up for a patient. These have been prevalent lately, especially at JenCare Senior Clinics. I did not think much of it, usually they're fairly short, but a tip is out of the question because they're booked by a third party. 

I pull up, patient is wheeled to my car, and belongings are put in the trunk. Then I slide "start". 

198 mile trip. Already hungry and tired, EZ Pass running low, and no compensation for 190+ miles to get home. 

I turn to the door to hopefully grab the staff, they vanished into thin air. Called from the app, went to the patient. 

Apologized to him profusely and escorted him to a bench in front of the door. I tried to explain that he would need to tell the hospital that he needed another car and to let the driver know in advance that it was an extremely long trip. He did not seem to understand that, but did understand why I had to cancel. 

Medical staff and patients often seems to think that all we do is medical transport if we pick up at a hospital or clinic. They do not understand that we're Joe Regular Uber Driver. 

And it's very frustrating, especially after years of doing actual medical transport - including trips such as this, but being paid almost $30/hr regardless of dead miles, driving a vehicle that doesn't belong to me, and not paying for fuel or tolls. 

I really hope he got a ride somehow. And flipping the bird to Uber for not indicating that this was a 40+ minute trip.

Name: Ummm5487
Story:
I know i know i know!!! No one in the history of man kind has ever uttered them words ..but through all the bulsht uber may do...when i stop and think of the alternatives I stand behind this statement...for me and many others uber was a God sent gift that came just in time...I despised with a passion working regular 9 to 5 inside jobs...which is why i drove buses and cabs for many years...but even then i hated having to ask permission to take a day or week off...plus I feel theres no real jobs that i qualify for that will pay me what my time is worth....
Then enters uber...this week with bonuses im set to make nearly 2k last week just working the weekend i made 1k...thats unheard of with any job i ever had...name me a job thatll pay 30 bucks plus a hour with no college degree besides maybe trucking

Name: Aw Jeez
Story:
When I switched from taxi driver to R/S, I got a lot of grief from some former cabbie friends. But as the taxi industry in my city evaporated, one of my major critics wisely decided to switch over too. He turned in his leased cab, bought a little Chevy four-door, and signed up with Lyft (but  Uber for some reason).

He did Lyft for a couple of weeks - enjoyed the money-in versus expenses-out. This past Monday, I texted him and asked how his weekend went? "Great!" he said. "I made $315 on Saturday and Sunday." I thought that was pretty good, because Saturday was so rainy that I didn't even drive. Then he added, "But I made all of that delivering food. I don't even do Lyft anymore. Too much driving!"

And there you have it. Uber and Lyft could not have predicted the rise in food-delivery services, and the need for them during this pandemic (which will continue). Bottom Line: Food delivery drivers make more money with less miles driven. They stay local, and don't go on any long trips like I did today:  trips over to Alabama with a deadhead back because I cannot take Uber  Lyft trips trips in Alabama.

I strongly suspect that more and more R/S drivers are switching to food for the same reason(s) as my friend. And so I am not surprised that Uber and Lyft have gotten super-busy here in my town, where it used to be pretty slow. Me? I'll stick with passengers. The numbers are okay by me, and I don't want to deliver food.

Name: Seamus
Story:
These people who brag about every single one of them being the same level of perfection are mind boggling! Why do you want every one of them the same in your group? Being all the same is boring and not what your group should be about!

Oh I know, some of you will accept a few being different in your group and claim you are open to being diverse and inclusive. That's nonsense!!! If you want to be inclusive then don't try to PREVENT all from being present in your little group!!! Each and every one is to be EMBRACED and shouldn't be complained about when they appear! Stop crying about "oh that one isn't like the rest, it's so unfair".

I am proud that I have achieved a level of diversity and inclusiveness that few can achieve. Yes, one of them is extremely difficult but don't give up, keep trying!

I am honored to have ALL types included in my grouping. I'm sure many on this forum can't say the same!

Name: BobDaScotty
Story:
Well,

I missed the big 2k trip, I am 2078 now.

Rating up to 4.94 since I have been swerving Philly for the most part.

The bonuses are good there but the damage to wheels, struts and rating make it a losing proposition unless the bonuses crest $10. 

I am happy being a suburban driver for the moment.

Name: Benjamin M
Story:
So, during the first and second waves of the pandemic, I tried my best on X.

I went from somewhere around a 4.94 rating (that began to fall before the shit really hit the fan, low quality pax) 90%+ AR, and Diamond status, to - 58% AR, 7% CR, and stuck at 4.88 (I'm sure I have been rated, however the numbers haven't budged).

I started X again when Eats had technical issues and customer tips fell sharply. At the same time, a driver buddy began doing X in the same market, brand spanking new.

While he's staying roughly in the same area (from my understanding), I'm getting TONS of ridiculous pings - awful ratings, long distance to pick up, and nothing remotely near the city (which has had consistant surges).

110 miles today, rounding up to four hours online (went offline for about 20 minutes hoping to get trips in the city), untold how many unpaid tolls, and I made $68.

The driver shortage is definitely a factor right now (see "PLEASE DRIVE") but it also appears that the algorithm is leaning towards brand new drivers like my buddy (well established on Eats, brand new to X) and giving me the bird.

It's so frustrating to have ENDLESS pings all day, every day, but the vast majority of them are not profitable. Combined with not having trip duration because there's no way I will hit 85% AR.

Thousands of trips on Uber, I'm getting the scraps.
