Name: sumidaj
Story: I'm on the food delivery side of UBER and don;t do passensgers......but wow...these stories are becoming more common.... .

Name: JohnJames8678
Story: Ok, so if you are creepy or look like Shrek mixed with Seth Rogen this probably won’t work, but when I used to drive Lyft back in my early 20’s I had luck with this little trick. I would whip out bumble or tender whenever someone hot pinged me. I’d get the date app pulled up and start swiping as the passenger was walking up. They’d get in and see i would have bumble and then mention something like “omg your on bumble too” and BAM you’ve got them thinking about dating and the conversation started. I’d follow it up with something like “I’m new at this, I just downloaded the app and thought I’d give it a try, I’m not too sure how it works”. This was like chum in the water. Play innocent, she might ask to switch upfront and wanna look at your phone to see your profile and your face up close. Keep some fire matches in your bumble deck so when she looks at your phone she notices you’ve got hot woman you’ve already matched with, this will bring out her competitive spirit and make her just a bit insecure and jealous. Trust me you’ll actually appear more attractive #ProTip. Also, Have a GOOD profile picture. Men I cannot emphasize this enough. Be sure you have a nice headshot, no double chin taken from the front seat of your car. Get in good lighting, put a nice shirt on, wash your face and comb your hair and use your portrait mode selfie in good lighting then upload it to Lyft. Accentuate that jaw! Ok, now back to my advice. She’s chatting with you now! This will lead into 1 of 2 avenues. 1 she’s taken or uninterested, in that case she will usually give you tips on your profile and you can max out your bumble game or 2 she’s single and y’all hit it off and you get her number. Just a little tip that seemed to work.

Name: Reina1
Story:
I rarely take an Uber anywhere but I had to go pick up my car so I did
During the ride, the driver went on and on about her rating and she doesn't know why it's low cause she's had so many 5 stars
At the end, she asked me please could I give her 5 stars so her rating would go up.
It just felt a little odd. And a little desperate. Maybe cause she kept talking about her rating.
When I used to drive, I never asked someone to give me 5 stars
Maybe it's just me, but I wonder do you guys ask your pax to give you 5 stars?

Name: Young Kim
Story:
I picked up a pax in Chicago, and as we talked, he said to me, "You seem like a very knowledgeable guy, could you please give me advice on what to do with my girlfriend?" "We are having issues." His real name I remember was Lorenzo. (I don't see an issue with saying his real name because he did not disclose anything illicit or extremely personal...it is just sort of an innocent story). I replied, "OK, I'll try to do my best." He said, "Well, my girlfriend said we should try to stop something we are doing... and be more responsible". (I wondered if it was something bad like drugs or gambling or overspending). 

He went on to say that his girlfriend is starting to feel guilty about how they are sexually active. Lorenzo said that he wanted to get married to her soon, and she expressed that she felt the same about him. The issue was that she felt if they are planning to get married, she should not be sexually active prior to marriage. She said that there was a thing about "re-virginizing oneself". He said he was frustrated that he would have to wait for sexual fulfillment. He said he was 32 years old, and his girlfriend was 28. 

At least to me, he was very gentle, sort of shy, and the sort of person that could not hurt a fly. I remarked to him about this, how gentle and kind he seemed, and he said that has always been his personality. I asked him about his girlfriend (advising him not to get too personal) and he said his girlfriend was the same. I then asked if religion had anything to do with his girlfriend wanting to "re-virginize" herself (I pondered if she was Muslim, where pre-marital sex is particularly frowned upon. 

He told him that both he and his girlfriend were Christian. I then asked him, "Do you want to marry her then? Do you see a forever long term relationship with her?" Without hesitation, he said that he does, and that there is no other for him. So then I advised him, "Well, then bro, the answer is obvious... get married right away, don't wait. If you know she is "the one", and she is going to withhold sex from you now, then just get married immediately".

He replied that the issue was his family was very very large, and that both of them talked about it and how having a wedding during this pandemic would be exceedingly difficult. So they felt they needed to wait...

I then suggested a solution that he got really happy to hear... I told him that a few of my younger cousins secretly got married this year, just in court, without telling anyone in the family. They did so for many reasons, and they did not want to say just invite a few people in the family and have others feel left out. But, they immediately told everyone in the family through a group e-mail that they plan to have the BIG family wedding AFTER the pandemic restrictions lift and then everyone will feel included.

This solution seemed to surprise Lorenzo, and he said, "Omg, why didn't I think of that before?!" He thanked me profusely, and seemed incredibly happy. Then he said that he would propose the idea to his girlfriend right away. After he left, I could tell that at least he was sincere because he left a $5 tip on a rather short ride. Sometimes, we ants have to play therapist. In this case, I found a solution that the pax really appreciated. 

Question for my fellow ants...have you also had a situation where you found a keen solution to a relationship issue that the pax latched onto?

(The next day I asked some female friends that I have if "re-virginizing" is a thing before marriage....and I found that many of them agreed with Lorenzo's girlfriend.... that many women do this to buttress their feelings of innocence and integrity as a lady. I suppose that I learn every day. I heard of this, but I really did not know how prevalent such a thing really was.)

Name: Young Kim
Story:
This was a first...not just one, but two of my pax fell flat onto the pavement as they exited my Uber. I picked up around 3:00 am three pax at a bar called "Drink" in Schaumburg, IL as the bar was closing. All three got into my car just fine, so I accepted them into my car. I of course would have thought of cancelling if they stumbled towards my car, but all three walked just fine.

But after they got into the car, I knew at least two were completely smash drunk. The girlfriend of one of the pax slumped over onto her boyfriend's shoulder almost immediately and passed out. Jose, the pax who ordered was sitting behind me slurring his speech profoundly. The boyfriend of the girl seemed OK, and spoke to me and Jose. As we drove, the boyfriend spoke to Jose and they discussed how awesome the night was, and Jose remarked about how utterly completely smash drunk he was, and how he vomited in the bathroom many times.

I could tell this was the case, as there was a stench of vomit as he spoke. (I think other ants could attest to this, you know the smell...) The boyfriend then told me that they do this a lot, go out and get completely smash drunk. Jose then told me and the boyfriend (of the girl who has passed out) how much he enjoyed the night.

I wondered about this, why people do this? I got drunk once..........but just . The experience was so physically uncomfortable and I hated the feeling of a loss of control. It would be like if I was driving a car, and the steering wheel got a ton of "play" in it, and the brakes were sluggish, and the accelerator did not respond, etc. Can anyone comment as to why people do this? I can not fathom how someone would regularly subject themselves to experiencing profound bodily sickness and a psychological loss of control.

Anyhow, when we got to the destination, all three got out, but the girlfriend was so disoriented. Suddenly, as she was walking, she collapsed onto the pavement...hard. I was shocked and got out, and I saw that Jose and the boyfriend lifted her and she seemed OK and smiled in an embarrassed way at me. I asked if she was OK, and all three assured me that she was. The two guys put her arms on their shoulder, and walked a few steps towards their apartment complex. But.....suddenly both Jose AND the girlfriend collapsed onto the pavement. (Not slowly falling down, and putting their outstretched hands down)...but just fell flat very fast and hard! I was alarmed and asked the boyfriend if they needed an ambulance. But he said no. I cautiously watched them to observe them for a few minutes. They got up and all three went in shoulder to shoulder and sort of did a dance swaying side to side moving as one body....until they disappeared right in the hallway.

I am writing about this because I have documented before on UP.net some very alarming instances of brutal intoxication. Can anyone hazard a guess as to why some pax do this on a routine basis? It appears to me some type of mental issue or masochism. Maybe once I can understand (never to be repeated), but to get smash drunk many times a month year after year and be pleased with the experience?

At least they were taking an Uber home....

Name: Young Kim
Story:
First trip last night in Chicago was some guy named Brian who told me that he had just finished a marathon run on playing Magic the Gathering with many friends...12 hours of it! He and his friends were overjoyed because they were all celebrating as a result of the massive stimulus being passed. He was a laid off worker from an advertising company in Chicago named Leo Burnett. 

We talked about his group of friends who he was playing the games with, and one of them was a laid off airline engine mechanic at O'Hare airport. I can't now remember the airline. Anyway he said that his friend was asked back by the airline to start work again. He told me his friend refused, because of the extended unemployment until September. his friend said that even though there's little chance of getting covid at his job because he is an airline mechanic, he is entitled to a very long paid vacation after putting in so much time with the airline. His other friends also felt the same way. I browse through other websites on my downtime. Majority of laid off workers with the extended unemployment/ PUA all feel that they deserve this gravy train. 

I hope that finally when they have to go back to work they're prepared to do so and keep their job skills up-to-date. as for the airline mechanic I'm afraid that his job might not be waiting for him when he's finally ready to return. his job is not like driving for Uber where you can just log on and start taking rides.

Name: Young Kim
Story:
Weekends are when I get my best stories, and I thought this one was interesting. I picked up a pax named William near the Merchandise Mart train station in downtown Chicago, and we got to discussing the pandemic and how he was dealing with it. He shared with me that just over a year ago, he was let go from the most fun job he ever had. He was working for Yelp! (the company who does the online reviews for restaurants and local businesses). He said that it was by far the most fun he ever had, and he was making great money.

William said that the top salesman for the downtown Chicago office made over $30,000 in commission in a month! before the pandemic crushed business. He said he was one of the top salesman and made six figures. And......he loved the environment. He told me about how there was pre-pandemic nearly 1000 people in the Yelp! downtown office, and after you go through security, it was a job workplace heaven. He gave the funny analogy that the "pit" where everyone was selling was like in the movie "Wolf of Wall Street", and how when someone got a big sale, everyone would know because some "horn" would go off and everyone would go over and congratulate the salesman. (He mentioned though there was no drugs or dwarfs thrown).

The pax told me that there were ping pong tables, other amenities like board games and lounge chairs (to be used during break), and FREE BEER and FREE FOOD! And he said it was very good food, all you can eat. I was surprised because I thought that only like Amazon, Facebook, and Google had this type of workplace amenities. I didn't know Yelp! had that kind of money.

William told me that the company really cared about making employees happy. He said that as the pandemic crushed business, Yelp! tried hard to keep as many people onboard and on payroll. He said that he started working remotely from home, but it was totally soul crushing. After all, restaurants and businesses closed down, and trying to get new clients was darn near impossible, he said.

He said Yelp! paid some bonuses and tried and tried,...but in the end, it was not enough, and he and most everyone was let go. He said there is still a shell left of his team in the downtown Chicago office, and he has no ill will towards his former company because they tried so hard to survive, but the Chicago location collapsed anyhow. After a few months on UI, he found a job with FedEx as a driver, and he was being dropped off in the Niles, IL location (by Touhy ave and Niles Center road). He seemed happy enough as a FedEx employee, and we both discussed that business was BOOMING for FedEx and his job is likely secure as an ironclad chain.

But wistfully, he lamented the loss of the best job he said he ever had in his life....

Name: ANT 7
Story:
This is from the........."I wouldn't believe it unless I saw it myself"..........files.

Yesterday at about 1145 AM I was stuck at a red light in heavy traffic in front of a McDonald's drive thru. Apparently, two vehicles had tried to enter the single D/T lane at the same time, a white van (who was in the right, appeared to have been first, and had the legal ROW regardless) and a red Ford Taurus that was trying to butt in front of him by entering from the busy avenue I was stuck on (which is illegal to stand/stop on when trying to enter the D/T lanes of this McD).

Dude in the van is calmly talking out his window to the Taurus pax, when the driver of the Taurus exits his vehicle and walks over to the van and proceeds to start punching the van driver. So, the van driver backs up, parks, and exits his vehicle with his cell phone held in a position that made it obvious he was filming. Taurus driver grabs the cell and throws it Tom Brady style across all four lanes of traffic, where it bounces against the side of the wall of a Money Mart, and lands on the sidewalk. Yes, it was that kind of neighbourhood.

Van driver runs across the traffic, grabs his phone, turns and runs back across the traffic, but doesn't stop. He picks up speed and when he is about 5 feet from the Taurus driver, he jumps in the air Bruce Lee style and lands a left food directly on the Taurus driver's jaw sending him to the ground like a wet towel. An EPIC take down to say the least.

Taurus drivers G/F gets out of the car yelling "OMG you've killed Johnny"........he's not dead BTW, he's just lying flat on the parking lot like J/C about to get nailed to the cross. Van driver gets back in his van and drives away. The red light changes color, and I do the same.

I hope they weren't fighting over who was going to get the last "Happy Meal"........could gave called this thread......."Floridamen invade Kanaduh".........

Name: Young Kim
Story:
On Saturday night at 3:30 am, I had a pickup in Skokie, IL (a north suburb) by AMC Theaters also near Red Robin and Buffalo Wild Wings. I swiped right, and saw the three young men entering my Uber were going to the Hyatt Place in Rosemont, IL, about a 13 minute ride. Immediately I noticed they were drunk, but even more vexing...very loud. They began to ask me many questions, about everything. I answered abruptly with monosyllables. They were loud... ugh. Then, one of them got on their phone and put it on speaker and called some girl. Then they all proceeded to have a group discussion of their night, also asking me questions to try to involve me in their drunken talk. 

It was the end of a long Saturday night, which are always very taxing for an Uber ant. Especially now during the pandemic, it has gotten so very much worse. So I was not in a mood to feign interest with 3 very loud annoying pax who was discussing their hard partying with some girl they all knew. I could hear them talk stuff like, "Yeah, when we sat down on the table and that other group approached I was pissed...", "Don't you think that the promoter will be interested in holding that party for next weekend?"...stuff like that.

So, I put on my Sony "almost" noise cancelling headphones (with very snug earbuds), and turned on some peaceful classical music at a loud volume. I told them that I need to listen to the Uber navigation system to insure that I drive to their destination properly, so I may not be able to communicate with them. Suddenly, as the soft notes of the symphony emerged, the three annoying pax almost seemed to magically disappear from my car. I could hear them still trying to talk to me, gesturing at me, and one even tapped my shoulder trying to get my attention.

I did remove one earbud and asked, "Is there a problem?", and he answered, "No, I just wanna ask you how...(this and that)". I interrupted with, "So sorry, but I need to hear the Uber navigation. It is very important." And then put back on my classical music... 

Soooo nice. It was suddenly like I was in another world of peace and harmony.

I think they got the message, because at the end of the ride, they just got out without saying a word, and I did not say "goodnight" either. I recommend everyone get a pair of very snug blutooth headphones (preferably noise cancelling), which will drown out annoying pax. I am doing this more and more now, with great results.

The only issue of course is that you won't be able to hear other traffic, like someone honking their horn. And most importantly, you must redouble your sight for any emergency vehicles since you won't be able to hear sirens. But....I think that at least for me, it is totally worth it. When an annoying pax is about to test my patience, some Mozart, Beethoven, or Handel will help me immensely.

For myself, I care nothing at all about getting a one star review from the pax if they feel I am ignoring them. If they are loud and obnoxious, I put them on ignore... with great satisfaction and relief.

Name: Guido-TheKillerPimp
Story:
I, like most if not all of you hopefully, do my best to avoid hitting any innocent animal, but accidents happen. Thankfully, I have only hit one rabbit and it was quick. He didn't feel a thing, and I had no chance in avoiding him.

Name: ThraddashTorch9517
Story:
So when I started this ride, the destination said Hospital, and my initial instinct was to cancel, but like a noob I ignored it. A minute into the ride I try to play it cool and casually ask, "So ... do you work at the hospital?"

He says no, he's going because he's "not feeling well".

Me: What's wrong?
Him: I just came back from a restaurant and started getting stomach cramps, cold chills, nausea.
(Um ...)
Me: Oh my gosh, did you call 911?
Him: Yes, they sent a truck, but it was too expensive to ride it to the ER.
Me: Did they do a covid test?
Him: No, but I just tested negative two weeks ago.
Me: I guess those symptoms sound like it could also be food poisoning.
<awkward silence>
Him: It couldn't be covid. I couldn't have developed symptoms so soon after eating there.
(Right, because the restaurant's the only place he could've gotten it.)
<more awkward silence>
Him: Are you feeling nervous?
Me: Maybe just a little bit. 
<step on gas>
Him: Don't worry, I'll give you good tip.
(Yes, that would make it all worth it ...)

I decide not to pull over and end the ride. Not sure what would happen to my karma rating if I did that. I'll do a good deed and see where it takes me.

(Hours later, saw the tip: $3.45)

Screen shots of the entire fiasco along with my description of events sent to Lyft support.
Lyft support issues me a $30 cancel fee (noted as a bonus).
Hey Clinton you jerk, guess who got the last laugh! 😁

Story: Did everyone get this pro

Name: #1husler
Story:
Tonight I PUed a pax named Lane (on the app), who then said he's actually "Corey", then later say no his "real name" is "Thomas"...proceeded to tell me that cops are hiding in the bushes looking for him, so he called "the operator" and it was a "line to heaven" that advised him to pray even though it "wouldnt help"...on and on and on, 10 mins ride with none stop "stream of consciousness" stories...he didnt seem drunk or high (I get A LOT of those), wasn't threatening or "scary", just seemed to have mental health issues.

Name: Young Kim
Story:
Saturday night February 27th was a very unique evening in the sense that I nearly hit one pedestrian, and had to brake rather hard for another (but I saw the latter coming easily). Also, I very regrettably sent a bunny into rabbit heaven. It was strange because I do sometimes have to narrowly avoid clueless pedestrians, but this all happened within a short span of time in one night. The first was the most jarring, because I nearly (without exaggeration) came very close to striking a pax darting out from between two cars into another Uber. (I do just wish to point out that I was not speeding at all, and rather driving about 3-4 miles under the speed limit). 

I was driving southbound on Linder Ave approaching Lawrence Ave in the north side of Chicago, and on a narrow street, when a would be pax literally jumped out from between two cars and ran in front of my car to their Uber across the street. I hit the brake and gasped at how close I came to hitting him/her. After stopping, I saw the other Uber ant's face who was parked look at me ...and we both shook our heads in disbelief. His pax, in a white parka jacket, with fur on the hoodie so I could not see the face, jumped into the Uber, completely not even acknowledging that he/she (I could not tell) almost got seriously injured. The street was 30 mph, so if I did not brake hard, I doubt the pax would have had life threatening injuries, but he/she would have been gravely hurt.

How many of you have had a person sprint in front of your vehicle running for their own Uber?

Next I was driving west on Harrison Street by Halsted next to the UIC campusk a short while later, and I saw a bunny suddenly jump into the street in a hurry. I slammed on the brakes (I was doing an UberEats order so there was no pax in my car), and veered right fast. As the car decelerated quickly, I thought I cleared the bunny easily......but...it jumped back right into my path under my tires in the last split second!

Squirrels (very common) I have avoided easily because they move in a predictable trajectory, and at constant velocity and zero acceleration. Deer are easy to avoid because they are large and move slowly. Geese or birds are even easier because they move either very very slowly or just fly away. But this bunny was moving and darting all over the place! As it jumped into my path, it hopped like up, left, down, and then finally back to my right...just as I thought I missed it. I heard a thud... I felt awful and disgusted, then hoped that it was not the bunny.

I slowly backed up away left from center...but I saw the heap of rabbit lying in the road. I am not sure why that bothered me so much, but I felt really awful. But not guilty. Because I knew that I did everything I could to avoid that bunny. Plus I was as I always am paying close attention to animals. And I was not speeding at all. It was the very first time in my life I hit a bunny, and noted that I could not have predicted its movement, as it seemed in retrospect completely random and unpredictable. Its last jump was right into my tire paths...sigh.

And so surprisingly (because it happened again shortly later), my next pax pickup was further south in the south side of Chicago by Roosevelt Ave and Racine Ave (a rather faster moving bigger street, 35 mph) I saw a man just run across the street in front of my car. However, I saw him running from the sidewalk easily, as his path was not obscured by cars like the first pedestrian I mentioned who appeared suddenly in between two parked cars. I ended up braking hard though, and he slowly just walked in front of my car as I came to a complete stop. I was a bit unhappy that some people just run into the street (even on a busy street) without looking at ALL. 

I am certain that all Uber ants have come close to hitting clueless pedestrians and likely causing roadkill of animals through no fault of their own. But have any of you actually HIT a pedestrian? Please do share your story of near misses...

Name: Merc49
Story: Heres how the stimulus works, a traveling salesman stops at a hotel and asks to personally inspect rooms to see if he wants to stay there. The clerk says to leave a 100 dollar bill as deposit to look at the rooms. While the guy checks the rooms the clerk takes the bill and runs across the street and pays his $100 bill at the food store for the hotel food. The store manager takes the $100 and runs to the hooker he owed for sex. The hooker runs back to the hotel and pays the clerk the $100 she owed for the room. The salesman comes back and grabs his $100 bill and declines the stay at the hotel. Everyones debt was paid off but nothing was produced from the money. Food for thought, me I'm investing it in silver with hopes it will produce more money.

Name: Ozzyoz
Story: Drivers are happy to take me to far away destinations for cheap.

Name: Young Kim
Story:
OK, just when I thought this job cannot get any worse... it did, tonight, a couple of hours ago. I would like to ask at the end if anyone has had a most frustrating pax than the one I just had. The pax was a long pickup in Des Plaines, IL. The name on the app was Jordan. (this is in the northwest suburbs of Chicago, IL, in a middle class suburb). Pax came out of a nice apartment complex. The pax comes out, and everything starts off OK. But then he asks me, "Do you have an aux cord?" (Warning to newbies, never ever offer an aux cord if asked, pax will demand you play their music at full blast on repeat the entire ride). I said no of course. Then he asks if he can Blutooth his phone to my car speaker system. I replied of course, "No, sir, my blutooth system does not work."

Jordan tells me that he wishes to have me listen to his and his friend, "Kuta Magnificent"'s recent hip hop song (which he argued would be the single top most downloaded song on Spotify, predicting at least a BILLION downloads... I said, "so sorry Jordan, but my blutooth system does not work, but if you tell me the song, I'll look it up after I get home tonight, OK?" Jordan just gets his phone out and starts playing his and his friend's song....... , but the song title was ... (that's right, that  was the name of the song)

I could not believe the garbage that came out of his phone... Mind you, I enjoy all music, including hip-hop and rap music. But his song, "In the Shit", was 5 minutes of a guy singing, "He is in the shit.", "Bweetch (you all know the actual word) is in the shit", "My boy is in the shit", "(the N-word) is in the shit", "My homie is in the shit" interspersed with all manner of profanity and vulgar language describing criminal behavior (like shooting drugs, defaming women, committing crimes, etc). I heard the song 4 times in the 20 minute ride... I had to bear hearing some guy rapping the words, " probably more than two hundred times. I tried to be polite... but I could feel my remaining feelings of positivity towards pax being wiped away, like a vestigial organ or decaying body part.

He asked me to be friends on Facebook and Instagram over and over. I replied, "Sorry, Uber community guidelines prohibit such communication". Then at the end of the ride, he asked me AGAIN if I could look him up on Instagram and download and listen AGAIN to his fabulous song, "In the Shit", and tell all my friends about it. He said he and his friend, "Kuta Magnificent" would become big, as big as Drake, Lil' Wayne, Jay-Z, and The Weeknd. Now, I really enjoy much of the work of the previous artists... But his song, "In the Shit"... was literally the worst piece of hip-hop I have ever heard.

I already had a stacked order right behind this ride, and so I told Jordan that I cannot stop and look up and download his song, "In the Shit". I showed him on my app the green dot after his ride proving that I indeed had another rider who had been waiting a very long time. I told him that the next rider is already waiting 20 minutes, and therefore I could not take any more time since the ride was over. At the end of the ride when we reached the destination, I swiped right and asked very politely if he would exit the vehicle since the next rider had been waiting.

Then he got upset and really bizarre...

Jordan said his real name was "Kuta Amazing", not "Jordan" (so I really don't know his real name now). He kept insisting...then ... that I look up and download his song, and spread the "incredible" work of art of his and his friend's to my friends and my social media connections. When I said I cannot right then but I will do so after my shift was over, he started calling me a "dumb Asian boy" over and over...like 20 times! He said I was missing out on letting others know how great his song, "In the Shit" was.

I steadfastly insisted that he exit my vehicle, he just refused over and over...and just sat there. He argued that the next passenger does not have a song as great as his, so I would be justified in making the next passenger wait. I replied that it is unlikely that the next pax is even a hip-hop singer. Also, I tried to explain to him that it was very inconsiderate to make someone wait for such an endeavor.

Then he got quiet... and I started to feel a bit nervous. Maybe 45 seconds passed of silence, and I contemplated calling for help (through the Uber app or 911). But this was a moment to try to prevent any escalation. I was in a safe middle class neighborhood in Illinois after all. And he was not being immediately threatening... Rather, he was simply refusing to exit the vehicle and seemed insulted that I would not download his song then and there.

I tried to say encouraging things, positive things, to make him feel better and have him exit the vehicle. Finally, a car approached from behind us, and I told him that I must insist that he exit the vehicle immediately. As I drove forward to allow the car behind me to pass, he  opened the car door put his feet out as his legs dragged across the cement and yelled, "Bweetch, why are you moving the f'ing car?!"... (I immediately thought to myself, "WHY ARE YOU OPENING THE CAR DOOR AND TRYING TO STEP OUT WHILE THE VEHICLE IS MOVING??!) I was stunned...he could have seriously injured himself.

I stopped fast to avoid him being dragged under my wheels. When the car stopped he finally got out... Never was I more happy that a ride had ended. Strangely, he waved bye to me and smiled!

Since the pandemic began, this job has gotten more and more challenging as the months have passed (I have driven without interruption all months of the past year). To those of you sitting this out during the pandemic, it is likely a very wise decision. I think my sanity is slowly withering away. I think I may start posting like  or maybe far far worse soon if this constant march of negativity does not destroy the final fragments of love and faith I have left for humanity... As I drove off, I literally thought I was dreaming...having a terrible nightmare. Like I really could not believe I had such a crazy passenger... I reflect now that maybe he was high on Crystal Meth or Crack Cocaine...

(Below I will upload a one minute video YouTube link of "Jordan" or maybe his name is actually "Kuta Amazing" at the end of the ride as he refused to exit my vehicle. You can hear at least one instance of him calling me ... he called me that at least 20 times at the end of the trip, just because I refused to sit and download onto my phone his magnum opus, "In the Shit". I can see that upon listening to the audio that I am talking rather fast, normally I do not. But I was very agitated on trying to have him exit my vehicle ASAP. Also, I did not take video footage of his face...)


At this point I am sure everyone knows that I really try my best to be as patient, compassionate, and caring as a person should while driving Uber. But after this ride...... I can see how people can lose their sanity. I am hoping  does not have to read a post of mine in the future where I demonstrate an unbridled hatred of humans. I cannot allow myself to go there.

Finally, I wish to state unequivocally that I was NOT exaggerating the utter sheer insanity of this pax and the aspects of this ride...this all really happened! Before anyone questions why I did not yell and scream at the passenger to "Get the F out of my car!", you had to see him and how bizarre he was acting at the end. I thought it best to not agitate him.

Name: FLKeys
Story:
I got a call from Uber Support that one of my previous PAX said he left his wallet in my car and asked me to call the PAX or text support back.

I checked my car no wallet. Texted support back saying no wallet in my car, sorry. Well Uber support was nice enough to give the PAX my phone number. Get a call and it says SPAM Risk, okay I love messing with these people, I answer. It is my PAX that says her husband left a wallet. I tell her I replied to Uber they should have forwarded the reply to her. She said they did but she knows the wallet is in my car and she wants it back.

With that attitude I said I checked, its not here, sorry. Good Bye and hung up. She tried calling me back 4 more times. I get a call from another number, I don't answer. They leave a message. It is the husband, he tells me he knows the wallet was in his right hand when he got in my car (he got in the driver side rear door) and he put the wallet in the middle of the seat to answer his phone and forgot to grab the wallet when he got out.

I text back that there was no wallet in my car or if he did leave it one of my next PAX must have seen and took it. 

20 minutes later I get a 1 ⭐ rating pop up. Oh well, don't really care about the rating. This morning I realize his story was detailed enough that it should show in my dash cam. You can clearly see him walking up to my car with empty hands. You can see him get in the car and his right hand is clearly empty. You can see him answer his phone and never have a wallet or put it down.

I texted him back this morning saying I reviewed my dashcam files and he did not have a wallet in his hand when we walked up to my car and when he got in my car he clearly did not have any thing in his right hand. Thanks, for the 1 ⭐ rating and no tip.

He never replied back.

Name: BobDaScotty
Story:
Wee hours in Philly...

Picked up two riders that after the first minute asked "Can you put something less white on?!" I was listening to WXPN, an indie station. 

They then had me stop at a wawa, leaving some bags inside the car and took 15 minutes doing whatever they were doing.

On the further journey they gave me a hard time about taking jobs from their people (they heard from my accent I am not American) and I told them that some nights I am driving 9+ miles to pick up and that most drivers simply will not work the hours when I do.

Dropped them off after their 1 hour ride to NJ. 

They left me zero tip and 1*

**** racist pax.

Name: Young Kim
Story:
All these long hours trying in vain to keep positive are weighing me down... and I can sense darker feelings coming over me. Around 2:00 am, I had a pickup at a bar in the northwest suburbs of Chicago in Arlington Heights. After the pax made me wait (I remember her name was Patricia) for 3 minutes, I saw her come out in a group of 4. I rolled down my window and said, "Sorry, but there is too many people". 

She was clearly drunk, and her face was red. She just stared with glassy eyes for a short while silently, and then said, "Well, can you still take me and my friends home?" 

I said, "Sorry, too many people". (I have a cooler and a bunch of stuff in my front passenger seat)

She replied, "Can't you move the stuff to the trunk?" "I'll tip you".

I replied to her that I could even though it is against Uber policy... but it may be easier for her to order a second Uber...

At this point, she acted all entitled... and she said angrily, "What is wrong with you?!" "Are you OK?" "Are you OK to take us home??!"

I felt something in me snap... (I thought to myself "obviously why the heck would I not be OK? it is you that is not OK because you are an angry drunk!")

I abruptly said to her, :"Hey! I'm cancelling this ride! I did nothing wrong here, and suddenly you are being rude to me. I don't take rude customers". She just stared at me in shock and disbelief... but then I think it dawned on her that she made a mistake. 

I felt such a joy cancelling on her. She did not think this through. Tonight, the wait times, especially in the suburbs, were LONG. Like 15-20 minutes long. And...people were telling me that Ubers were cancelling on them. And the bar she was at with her friends was closing. And, some pax were telling me that they saw the dreaded, "Sorry no UberX's in your area, pls try again later" in the northwest suburbs where I was driving. She may have to wait for 15-20 minutes (or longer), and would have to beg the bar to let her and her friends stay inside until another Uber shows up.

Drunk entitled pax often act in a manner that is completely illogical and detrimental. She probably thought in her drunken state that she could be rude and order the Uber drivers to do whatever she wanted. 

Big mistake... this was not pre-Covd in the middle of downtown Chicago. Her friends who were sober knew instantly the mistake Patricia made, and apologized and asked if I would bring them anyway. 

I said, "No." I knew also that once the ride started, she would complain and give me crap the entire ride, and obviously one star me (which I don't care about), but I didn't want to deal with an angry drunk pax INSIDE my car. I found that if the pax before the ride even starts, sniffs of a problem, it is better to cut your losses... and get out of there.

Story: Dropped off a pax here today. Luckily I kept my doors locked, and got away unscathed.

Name: Jag2300
Story: Me & my mom drive for Uber in Phoenix she received a email stating that her account is flagged for fraud & 50% of her promotion is going to be taken away but she takes every call that comes to her mostly airport calls she completed 20 rides today for $35 but they still have not paid her the money

Name: Young Kim
Story:
This was an interesting ride in the sense that it echoes more or more of what I am experiencing with pax. I picked up a couple of young men in the southwest suburbs of Chicago (Western Springs), and brought them all the way up to the north side of Chicago. In this long ride, I had a lot of time to talk to them. Both were out of school now and wanted to become YouTube, TikTok, Instagram stars. They wanted to make it as recording artists...across social media. They told me that they do livestream feeds where people tune into their work, and as I understood it they mix music, like hip-hop.

Where it became more interesting to me was that they gave up looking for a stable job because the price of Bitcoin was soaring so much, that they felt they will never have to work a real job again for the rest of their lives. I did check after the ride ended, and I just saw it hit around $57,000 per Bitcoin. I feel like the pandemic low last year was around $5,000. They kept telling me that I should invest heavily in it... they spoke of it almost as if it was a new religion. They were talking one million dollars per Bitcoin...and stuff like that.

I heard that Uber may accept Bitcoin as payment...or some rumors of that?

I wished them well, and for their sake I hope that they achieve their dreams. But I wondered to myself if this is the right attitude? Can a plethora of young college age/college graduates decide and become successful cryptocurrency investors... and not have to work any real jobs? 

I am not sure if such an attitude is best. I do own some Bitcoin actually, and I don't recommend it or not recommend it here...but I wanted to share an interesting story about how many young people are banking on the price of it to allow them never to do 9-5 again. I am not so sure if that is a good plan. Even if it works, our economy will still need people to work right?

Name: kingcorey321
Story:
LOL getting any is something you may hear a teenage say to another . 
No really . I have been catching bonuses from Ic. 4 orders 50 dollars thursday.

I did both of them. I got the extra cash . 
I average 25 an hour no bonuses . With these bonuses 38 bucks an hour today .

Grocery stores were packed with people . The wait to check out took 20 or 30 alone .

Name: ANT 7
Story:
Nice 20 something woman, working for a major international chain that is quite a popular mid-level restaurant/bar setup in our market.

We hit it off at the start of the 30 minute ride, and it turns out she was in charge of take out and deliveries at this large place on the VD weekend. Decided to interview her on the sly for some UP content........heh.

They turned off all internet delivery apps after the first 2 hours (around 600 PM) because they were getting slammed on all fronts (DD, UE, and STD) and could not handle it. Mainy the apps though were causing the trouble. Too many people ordering and no kitchen can keep up, too many customers complaining, losing 30% in fees and having things sit an hour plus for pickups was the reason. As these are the least profitable orders by far, they got whacked.

Next was pick ups for take out from their own website, which were averaging about 3-5 orders every 15 minutes for about 3 hours straight. They track this metric in 15 minute segments apparently, and promote it with discounts and a points program for members.

They also had a 90 minute line to be seated until close, as they were not doing reservations. Covid here means you can only seat 50% capacity, so, they were being ruthless and doing first come first serve with a 90 min max seating time. Can't say I blame them.

Name: The Gift of Fish
Story:
I have come to the conclusion that there are a lot of driving techniques that are very different here in the Colonies, many of which fall under the category of, "How can you not know this?". 

As such, I'm genuinely interested to know which one of these options you believe to be correct.

Name: Young Kim
Story:
It started off fine... I picked up 2 pax at a bar in a suburb south of the city around 3:00 am. It was a couple. The guy suddenly started asking me if I was Korean. I replied, "Yes, sir, I am". He proceeded to ask me 27 times exactly if I was Korean on a 17 minute ride. Each time, I would answer "Yes." After around the 20th time, I started counting it back to him. "Yes, I am Korean, that is for the 22nd time"..."Yes, I am Korean, for the 23rd time"..."Yes, I am Korean, for the 24th time" etc. At this point, I went from being annoyed to very amused...

The girlfriend (who was very cute), started to apologize profusely and kept telling her boyfriend to shut up. She was quite friendly and tried to divert the repeated questions to other topics. She asked me if I thought she was fit and cute, showed me her stomach, to which I replied, "Of course!..."haven't you seen a mirror recently?"

Then... the boyfriend suddenly started asking me, " ...are you Korean?" over and over...

I calmly replied that both my parents are Korean, so my genetics followed from that biological fact... He in his drunken state, started to repeat that same question over and over... afraid to get to the 27th time for that question, I cut him off... I then answered by having a short talk about how there are 46 chromosomes in each cell of my body... consisting of 22 pairs, and two sex chromosomes...inheritance patterns, etc. And all this explains why my being Korean has a logical connection to my parents being Korean.

For my own amusement, I quickly pointed out how traits are inherited from each parent through DNA transmission according to Mendelian genetics... and again tried to explain that is the reason I am in fact Korean and not another race...

After a long silent pause... he again asked..."So...why are you Korean?"

I tried so hard not to laugh...

At the end of the ride, the girlfriend apologized again for her boyfriend, and then handed me a twenty. The boyfriend gets out, and is suddenly very friendly with me, and asked his girlfriend if she had tipped me well. She replied that she did and both disappeared into their apartment building.

I thought this ride which started out sort of annoying, ended up very amusing and funny. The 20 dollar tip at the end was very nice.

Name: Guido-TheKillerPimp
Story:
What was you biggest rookie mistake(s) as a RS driver that hopefully you will never forget, and have certainly learned from?
Myself, always ensure doors are locked upon arrival and "sizing up" the 
situation /paxs before unlocking. Especially at night!

Name: #1husler
Story:
I have mixed feeling about pax, the same as I would about any John and Jane Doe with whom I'd have to interact with out there, I guess.

But there is one variety of pax who I appreciate more than most...its the pax who unknowingly "aids and abets" me to weed out their low paying/potentially problematic rides by "outing" themselves with messages which reveal the "true colors" of what might transpire if I dare PU at their "pin drop".

Upon receipt of such messages I quickly cancel, then re-cast my net for higher paying rides/lower drama rides, saving me the hassle of having to haul it 5 mins down the road, only to see a nonsensical ride that I can't work with.

This is a thank you to them, because they keep my economic fly wheel turning, without having to break my vibe or mess up my bottom line.

The pax who sends these revealing message is indeed a special one...because unlike their stealthier counterparts (who KNOW what they/their rides are so mask their true location and/or identity or continually launch new accounts, to woo drivers back into their den), they volunteerily "tip their hand" to show me the kinda of ride most likely to suck time, money and energy out of my hustle, possibility ending my hustle on a sour note.

These message are super helpful in my market where U/L don't show pax destination (until you accept all the +25 min away rides and "score" a 95% AR or something like, which I DONT have)....one can sniff out rides which don't make financial sense by simply reading and understanding these pax messages.

Here are a few of my "choice" favorites, with interpretations:

Pax message: "We are at the Circle K" [and its 1am... just scored and need a mule, bruh!]

Pax message: "I have a lot of groceries" [so can you load our 2 carts full, drive .75 miles, park your nice new car in section 8 housing after dark and leave it unattended to run my stuff up 4 flights of stairs for $2.25 and..ooh, don't worry because I'll take care of you on the app]

The best one is...

Pax message: "You are picking my son up from middle school school" [thus violating your ToS on a ride which is not only awkward but not completely legal, and can result in legal action].

By the way...this message is a good one to screen shot, and then dash to U/L, inviting them to discuss ToS with pax.

Are there any pax messages you all get which prompt a quick cancellation?

Name: Benjamin M
Story:
So, I have been mainly sticking with Eats recently. 

For a while now, most restaurants have had dine in or in store pick-up around the city. However, a few have shifted to making us lowly drivers go around to the back entrance like it's a speakeasy. 

Had one last week, a Japanese restaurant. People eating inside, doors were open. Got a look of disgust from the host. 

"You are supposed to pick up at the back door. It says so in the app", with a "yuck, delivery guy" attitude. 

So, I went around to the back - a tight alleyway. Saw raw ingredients sitting around with a screen door open nearby. I rang the bell as I was told to and waited in the cold. 

I was finally noticed as the chef went to plop down what looked like a bowl of rice next to the door. Yuck. 

That's just one example, anyone else? And that place wasn't cheap.

Name: Lone wolf hunting
Story: On Real Time Feb 12, 2021 Bill Maher called Uber/Lyft drivers rickshaw operators. He’s right. Anyone else sick of pulling a cart around for people that care nothing for you or your well being?

Name: FLKeys
Story:
Yes, Juan in your red Toyota Sienna, I would like to thank you for demanding a $35.00 upfront cash tip from your passenger last night around 6:00 PM. 

Okay I know chances are real slim that Juan will ever read this.

Yesterday around 6:00 PM I get a ping for a trip 35 miles south, estimated to be 45 minutes long. I pull up and there are 3 ladies, mom and and two teens estimated in the 16-17 year old range. I verify identity and they all pile in the back seat. I know this trip is going to an area that is farther away from my house and chances of getting a ride back to my area will be slim but oh well.

Mom immediately gets on the phone and says we are in a second Uber and should be there in less than an hour. My mind starts to wonder??? Several minutes later Mom gets on the phone again, and I hear here say ride issue, okay she is on the phone with Uber support. After some frustration she gets connected to a person.

Basically, Juan in a red Toyota Sienna came to pick them up. After they were in the car he started the trip and saw where they are going. Guessing Juan does not have Uber Pro Status. She said Juan proceeded to demand a $35 cash tip up front because he would have to drive back 35 miles with no pay. She refused, Juan kicked them out and drove off.

She was going off on the Uber rep on the phone, she also had to repeat twice to the rep "No not Paul I am in his car now and we are heading to our hotel", it was Juan that was the problem.

Juan demanded $35.00, kicked out his PAX and his PAX rewarded me with a nice crisp $50.00 bill upon arrival to their resort. She thanked me for a nice safe professional ride.

On a side note I did several trips in that area while I was there and also my final trip in that area took me 14 miles back toward my house. Well worth the slight inconvenience of going 35 miles away from home.

Name: The Gift of Fish
Story:
Everyone hates Lyft's practice of foisting new rides on drivers as they are reaching the destination of their current ride. I decided to email Lyft to tell them to cut that shit out, not expecting a reply. But, they did reply, evidently not before taking a large draw on the company crack pipe.




Sure, Lyft, I will be sure to disable the "auto accept" feature in your app. It's on the fantasy menu, just below the "stop bugging me with nonsense about 'harming your community'" button and the "leave me the F alone and let me get on with my work" button. 😂🤣:roflmao: What a bunch of morons.

Name: MissAnne
Story: Holy crap .... and hubby has the car 😢😢

Name: The Gift of Fish
Story:
I got my first puker of 2021 last night. Uber has seen fit to remove the "request cleaning fee" help function from the Help section in its app, so I phoned the critical support number. Rohit said to send in photos and he would process the fee. A short time later, I got a message from him that he had assessed the fee and charged the pax $40 for puking on my car. It appears that the days of the insta-$200 puke fee are long gone. I told Rohit that $40 wasn't enough. He wrote back confirming that it was, and I wrote back confirming that it wasn't. It definitely isn't.




Anyway, Rohit said that the $40 would be credited to my account by the next pay statement, which ended last night. It wasn't. After further pressing, Rohit said that it would be paid out "in the next few business days". I replied that that was not good enough, and that since he had already charged the customer, I wanted payment now; there is no reason to delay payment. It looks like my emails are now being diverted into Uber's Bottomless Pit of No Reply email folder, though, as Rohit has stopped responding.

Uber puke fees used to be credited immediately to drivers' accounts. Has anyone else had Rohit play the make-you-wait game with them?

Name: ANT 7
Story:
This is the last window you'd ever think would be broken by a road hazard, but, it actually happened.

A pickup truck passed me at high speed on the right, which kicked up a rock, and then, CRACK !!! Took me 15 seconds to realize it was this window which was taken out, because, 99.5% of them seem to hit your windshield, and nothing more......right ? Kept staring at my windscreen looking for the damage, but saw nothing corresponding to the sound of the impact, until I checked my mirrors and saw this.

Dealer list price, because no used parts were available anywhere, was $299 CAD plus taxes.....they cut me 15% off, so I paid $260 CAD plus tax. FWIW an entire new front aftermarket windshield is a mere $275 CAD plus tax installed. Go figure.......heh.

It's only like a half an hour of tech time though to replace it. Pop of the inner plastic window trim, undo two small bolts, pop the entire assembly out (it comes as the glass, and frame, with mouldings attached) put the new part in, then reassemble it.

Name: Nightrider82
Story:
It’s been a while since I have been here. I just wanted to share a bit of success I have had and perhaps inspire someone who has been on the fence about taking the leap. In september I officially did my last Uber ride and although it had many ups downs I’m thankful for Uber because at a time of need when I need some extra income I was able to just do that. Uber is a terrible company to work for and after a while it does wear on you and I truly lasted as long as I could, after working a regular 9-5 I would put in 15 to 30 hours a week on Uber and did this for almost 2 years. September of 2020, I finally had enough I was working 7 days a week some days 14 hours a day between both jobs and I just needed a break.
In December i decided to give the stock market I try, my first month was a complete bust I lost about $1200 of my original $5,000 investment and completely took out all my investments. However after doing a lot more research and some studying and following the market I decided to give it another run. Since January 1st I have more than tripled my portfolio with a lot of success, some failure a lot of learning and much more learning left to do. This is definitely not for everyone but if you have an analytical brain and some good sense there is money to be made in the market. No I don’t have a channel, I don’t post what I buy or am I trying to get people to subscribe to anything. However if you have any inclination do your research and maybe start with a paper account, there is money to be made.

Name: The Gift of Fish

I see many cars with no disabled placard hanging from the rear view mirror or disabled licence plate parked in spaces for the disabled. It's usually a ghetto-special car, decked out with such crappery as ugly aftermarket rims, too-dark window tints etc, and the ghetto trash driving it is too lazy to walk an extra few paces.

On the other hand, in over-the-top California at least, businesses often have at least five times as many spaces for the disabled as are needed. These spaces very often have no cars parked in them, except for the usual aforementioned ghettomobiles. So maybe no harm is done by taking these spaces that would otherwise go unused.

What say you?

Name: Erik M
Story: Drove this past Sat night, was parked on side of PCH in Newport Beach south of the 55/Pinninsela exchange. I'm on my iPad with the music up so was unaware of my surroundings when a guy bangs on my passenger window. I roll it down and he asks if I could give him and his friend a ride, I tell him "No". He asks again and I said "No". He says OK and they start walking down the road. I continue doing my thing and 10 mIns later the same guy bangs on my window again, I roll it down and he says he'll give me $100 if I give them a ride to the next stop light, which is about 100 yards down the road. Something seemed off, who offers $100 to drive somewhere so close. I tell them "No, I have a prearranged trip". He says who the hell turns down $100 for a trip that close, i said "I do" and roll up my window. They stand in front of my car talking for about a min then cross the street and jump into a car parked on the other side of the road parked in the opposite direction and drive away. Whatever the hell they were up to, im glad I didn't fall for it!

Name: Mr.Do
Story:
I was doing some driving tonight, making pretty decent money when at about 9PM I got a phone call. Normally I have my calls screened so that if the number is not in my contact list it goes straight to voice mail, but I happened to have that switched that off because I was making some banking calls earlier in the day. I had a PAX in the car at the time so at first I ignored it, but then the call came again. So against my better judgement I answered. I am paraphrasing here a little bit but the person on the line said he was calling from Uber support and that since I was a stellar driver Uber was going to give me $500. I told him I had a fare and he said he would call back. 10 minutes later he did. He repeated his claim that he was going to give me $500. I parked the car and he proceeded to give my instructions on how to claim my cash. This involved changing the listed phone number in the app to one I did not know and then adding a debit card number to my cash out list. I went along with what he told me to do, but all the time I kept thinking something is not right. Before he could finish the process I hung up on him and tried to call Uber support. But of course it was in the evening and they are closed until Monday. Al the time the number came up again several times and then I got a text stating to call him back when I was ready to finish verification for my money. I am not going to do anything until I can verify this guy is who he says he is by calling Uber support Monday when they are open.

Was this a scam?? I don't know. But there is an old saying. "When something seems to be to good to be true, it probably is." Also, if you get a phone call in the middle of the night with a person wanting to give you money, alarm bells should be ringing.

I am pretty sure I almost lost a weeks worth of pay by cashing out to a strange debit card number. I am glad I wised up in time.

So this is a heads up to all drivers, there is some sort of scam targeting drivers out there. Beware of unknown calls offering you money.

Name: Young Kim
Story:
Several days ago when it snowed in Chicago (I think it was 8 inches), I was doing my shift overnight and saw at least 10-12 cars get stuck in the snow during my overnight shift. I am reminded of this as it is snowing hard right now on my night shfit. Cars would be turning from the main street into a side street that was unplowed... and would get stuck immediately. I am reminded of seeing roaches simply walking into a roach motel as a kid. It was so sad. I carried a shovel with me in the car, because I knew what would happen. 

I was able to save a few people by helping them dig out in between deliveries and pickups. But I definitely could not save all of them. When I did have one pax in my Uber, another car did swerve in front of me and almost hit us and slid backwards into a ditch. It was probably just a few feet away. I was driving so slowly so I was able to avoid him/her. It was the first BIG snowfall in Chicago in many years, so I suppose that people were not used to it. 

It was really sobering to see all the stuck cars. I myself only stuck to the main roads which were well plowed, and avoided any side streets which were not well plowed... Wait times I heard from pax were over an hour around 3:00 am. I was in a far suburb. When I picked some of them up, they were really grateful that someone was still out to get them. One guy actually said (his exact words, "Sir, you are like an angel that God sent to me tonight." 

The surge was good, about $7 per ride... I know I have seen surges much larger, but in Chicago that is pretty big...

Name: Justkeepswimming
Story:
Here in vegas we have a restaurant called dicks last resort. The premise is the waiters are ******** to the customers. I was pointing this place out to some pax on my drive suggesting they go and I mentioned I’d thought about working there. The pax immediately got excited and wanted me to try it out on them. So I looked em both up and down and said to the guy “she with you?” He nodded. “How much you payin her?” Then I looked at the girl “hey baby, I got a twenty for ya, we can go to the bathroom, actually on second thought that might be too clean for you”.

First time I’ve ever gotten a tip for insulting customers. I could get used to this!

Name: JohnJames8678
Story: Let’s get a thread going of the funniest stories you’ve encountered while on Uber.

Name: JohnJames8678
Story:
*Disclaimer* I’ve written a couple lighthearted dumb posts on this forum, but this story is more serious and dark. I don’t know if it’s even appropriate to . It involves someone who passed away from a drug overdose and it might be triggering to some. I mean no harm to the family or anyone who has lost someone to drugs or mental health. Please seek help if you or someone you know is thinking about hurting themselves. Suicide prevention hotline: 1-800-273-8255



This story happened about 6 years ago in San Francisco. It was a chilly night with no fog and a stiff breeze. It’s about 1am that night, I think it was like a Tuesday or something. Basically dead on the ride front. Anyways, as I’m sitting waiting for a ping I notice a guy in a nice suite slumped over on the corner of the sidewalk. People were passing by, and just stepping over him. Being in San Francisco there is homeless people and drug use everywhere so people are immune to this kind of stuff, but something was off. He had a suite on and looked different from the everyday bum. I told myself “don’t worry about it he’s just drunk” I was telling myself not to go over and check, but I’m looking at this dude not move and looking stone cold dead so I decided to get out of my car and go investigate. Well, turns out he’s alive, barely. I shake him awake and he’s moving and grumbling some nonsense. I call 911, which in San Francisco isn’t very useful. The operator on the line is asking me “sir is he breathing”. I’m trying to convey to her that he’s moving, but I think he’s just drunk or something. She says something that would ultimately cost him his life. She asked me “Sir do you want us to send an ambulance? We get a lot of these calls and if he seems ok maybe you can take him to a hospital if it’s safe for you” I was a bit surprised by that response. I was just asked to put him in my Lyft and drive him to the hospital. I end up rolling him over, he’s younger maybe 34, a good looking and clean cut Asian dude. I carry him to my car and sit him upright. He’s fumbling over, but I manage to strap him in my back seat. I start driving him to the nearest hospital ER. While we are driving I’m asking what his parents number is so I can let them know he’s in the hospital. He hands me his phone and after not unlocking it I’m forced to use his finger print to unlock it. I get in his phone and it’s all in a different language. I find a number he last texted in I message and copy it into my phone. I finish driving him to the hospital. I turn around and look at him and he’s dead. Like straight up eyes rolled back, dead. I run in to the ER heart pounding out of my chest thinking Jesus Christ I have a dead man in my car. The ER lady at the front desk hits the emergency button and a team of people rush out with a gurney and load him out of my car and wheel him into the ER. I don’t know what to text to the number, who it is or what I should say. I ended up saying “I found a man, and took him to the hospital, found your number in his phone” said my name and the hospital he was at and that was that. I get a call back a week later. It’s the person I texted. The man tells me the guy passed away from a drug overdose and mentioned he was his boyfriend and that the guy was depressed because he had just lost his law license and had a drug problem and they had just broken up. The boyfriend cried, but seemed almost relieved mentioning he had been a major burden on people. Like dang dude, he just died and your still gonna talk bad about him. Definitely a bad break up. It got weird after he offered to have my girlfriend and I have dinner at his restaurant for free for trying to save of his ex. He said this after he finished crying on the phone as I told him about the guys last moments. Anyways, this still haunts me to this day. Always get the ambulance if your unsure don’t let 911 convince you otherwise. 



End of story.

Name: #1husler
Story:
Tonight I rolled up to PU a pax who was standing there waving a cell phone (the universal sign to flag down a RS driver), only that this pax wanted me to PU the phone, not her!

Pax: Hey, can you "Uber" this phone back to this guy?...he's in a trailer park, follow the maps there, then drop it off to him.

Me: Huuuuh, can you call him to be sure he's standing there as I arrive, then I hand it off to him?

Pax: No, I dont have his number, just arrive, honk and he'll come out.

Me: No, that cant work for me, but best of luck getting the phone back him.

I was tempted to try to Uber the phone but... could see too many opportunities for this to go sideways.

Have any of you tried to courier things for pax (minus the pax)? I could see how it'd be easier (even preferrable) to drive a phone rather than a pax but...am curious how that works out.

Name: FLKeys
Story:
Saturday morning around 2:10 AM I get a Comfort ride ping, I recognize the name, I took them there earlier. As I pull up there is a Sheriff car blocking one of the entrances, his lights were off. I see a deputy shinning his flash light around in the trees and dumpster area. The PAX walk past the sheriff's car and get in my car. Place is usually still pretty packed at this time, the parking lot is pretty much empty.

We pull out and as I am going down the side road toward the main road I pass a couple more deputy cars heading toward the restaurant. Lights were off. I get out on to the main road heading toward their resort and not even a mile down the road I get lit up by a deputy. I pull over and the PAX are like what the hell. I'm like I have no idea, I'm not speeding and I made sure I came to a complete stop at both stop signs I went through.

I pull over and start getting my license, registration, and proof of insurance ready, turn on the interior lights, roll down all the windows and place my hands on top of the steering wheel. I look in my driver rearview mirror and don't see anything, I look in the windshield rearview mirror and catch a glimpse of movement on the passenger side. I look in the passenger side rearview mirror and see a female deputy reach over and touch the back of my car with her left hand, then I see she has her gun drawn in her right hand.

She gets to the rear passenger window and looks in and says you are not the car we are looking for you can go. Before I know what is going on she is back in her car and driving off.

Turns out the PAX tell me some guy came in yelling and screaming and threatened to kick every ones ass and shoot up the place. Caused the place to empty out pretty quick as last call was at 2:00 and they close at 2:30. Explains why the parking lot was so empty.

Name: W00dbutcher
Story: Uber Passenger

Name: #1husler
Story:
So, this isnt so much a "story" as it is an observation....that RS drivers' ability to bargain for more equitable terms/treatment is disabled by all the "hobby drivers", who aren't grinding it to make rent, but just do RS to get out of the house for a Dunkin Donuts run (score some decaf and a danish) and then what the heck, pick of a pax or two, maybe a few, then head back home for a visit from the grandkids.

Are you a hobby driver? Do you know who these guys are? Well...

I recently relocated to Tucson (sun-bird central), but still fly now and again for work, so (of course) use RS...the drivers picking me during day hours (not night) are kindly retired "old-timers" who drive all leisurely and seem oblvious to what they might make (or not make) per ride.

An example.

Me: Hey, I also do RS, hows it been going for you in Tucson?

Ernie: Oh, you know, I dont know, I just do it now and again, get a break from the mrs, its good to get out of that place at least one day and see whats going on out here, hehehe.

Me: Oh cool, ok, good to make some money too. Are there rides you tend to prefer or avoid?

Ernie. Nope. I just drive whatever, I go where-ever, pick up anyone.

Me: Whoa, thats different, because...for example, I avoid Walmart, I dont make enough money on those, having to load and off load 2 carts of groceries.

Ernie. Ohhhhhh I dont mind those, but I cant get out to help, because of my back and my knees.

Me: But...the wait, like, they only pay us 6 cents a min? Mann, I cant work for that, can you?

Ernie: Is that what they pay? I didnt even know...how much do they pay per mile? I dont much pay attention to these thing you know, I just drive, need to get out of the house once in a while, but not too long, or wifey might think I have a girlfrend, ahhahha!


I took Ernie's number, he was cool, friendly and I could call him direct for my airport runs, and put 100% of the fare in his pocket, though he probably "doesnt care".

I've noticed that pax have going bonkers on the multi-stops and grocery store PUs during the pandemic AND because these rides keep coming and coming, I figure enough drivers are accepting these PUs (otherwise RS would drop them OR offer drivers more money)....I wont touch these PUs, and dash them away... I used to wonder WHO picks up my left-overs.. it seems these hobby drivers happily take them. RS is neat hobby, but drivers who are you hustling it to make rent and pay for college, etc, wont be able to advocate for better pay with all these guys out there.

Are you a hobby driver? No shame in your game if you are....

Name: Young Kim
Story:
Saturday night around 3:30 am in Elmhurst, IL (southwest of O'Hare Airport), I drove up to the pickup location and saw 5 people standing there. I figured that there would be 2 parties and 2 or 3 pax would get into my Uber. But all five approached, only 1 was masked, and a guy tried to open my passenger side door...

(Potential pax): "Could you please open the door?"
(Me): "Ummm... how many are in your party?"
(Potential girl pax): "5 of us"
(Me): "Ummm... there can't be anyone in the front seat."
(Potential girl pax): "Well, all of us can squeeze in the back seat"
(Me): "Umm... I don't think all of you can squeeze in the back of a Prius.."
(Potential girl pax): "We can!"
(Me): "Also, where are your masks?"
(Potential girl pax who likely ordered the Uber): "Sorry...but I will tip you really big on the app"
(Me): "Umm... I'm so sorry... but..
(Potential girl pax): "Please... we waited so long for an Uber..."
(Me): "Can you please order an XL?"
(Potential girl pax): "We can't find one"
(Me): "How about two UberXs?"
(Potential girl pax): "Please can you fit all of us?"
... I'm really thinking here then why didn't they order 2 Ubers, but I realized this crowd was a few cards short of a full deck at this point... and this was the kind of bizarre behavior I would have expected over a year ago, but now? Where were these people living? I am now thinking that there was more than just alcohol involved in their past social gathering.
(Me):  "I'm so sorry. But it would be totally unsafe"... Then I cancelled and drove off.

My very next request was a ping to the Elmhurst Police Station. I figured immediately it was a DUI situation, as it was 4:00 am in the morning. When I got to the pickup location the pax was nowhere to be found. Then I received a text message:

(Potential pax): "Could you pick us up? We are walking down 1st Ave (I think it was 1st Ave)"
(Me) "I don't know where exactly you are, could you give me a cross street or address?"
(Potential pax): "We don't know where we are, my buddy got a DUI and we are walking home"
(Me) "Then why did you order an Uber?" (I was only 5 minutes from the pickup location so it wasn't as if they were waiting long for the pickup)
(Potential pax): "I dunno, but we are walking down some street and there is a stoplight in front of me"
(Me) "Sorry sir, that does not help me..."
(Potential pax): "Well, we are almost home now, could you cancel the ride? We are so sorry to bother you"
(Me): "Well, you should cancel the ride"
(Potential pax): "OK, good night"
(Me): "OK, bye!"

I waited til the timer ran down, but he cancelled right at the end. Easiest 8 bucks I made that night (2 times $4 cancellation fee)

I am wondering if anyone else recently had pax that seemed like they lost their senses and ability for rational thought...

Name: Benjamin M
Story:
I may post the video tomorrow, fudge it.

Haven't been driving much but went out today. Pings have been awful but stacked. AR is perpetually less than 70% because of ridiculous pickup distances and awful ratings (4.43 being one).

Stacked ping in the hood, 4.6x. Declined. Immediately after, 5* in another bad neighborhood (but not as bad, lots of college kids).

Account holder was a woman, I picked up a dude that looked like he's not unfamiliar with corrections. The trip was 98 miles (about an hour and forty minutes), northern Virginia. I didn't see a "45+ minute trip" on the ping.

Debated whether or not to take it, my gut said no. As always with these trips, I discussed a tip and we agreed on $20. He said his girlfriend's son was in the hospital.

With 53 minutes left on the trip, his girlfriend called and asked if "y'all are okay". I said yes, gave her our ETA. He was asleep.

Five minutes later, on the highway, the trip was canceled.

I woke him up, told him what happened, and said I would drop him off at the next exit. "No, you'll take me back to where you picked me up!"

Negative 😂

He was cool after I explained that I had no idea what happened with his girlfriend and I don't drive for free. He said his phone only works on WiFi and I dropped him off at a McDonald's, about five minutes after the trip was canceled.

As I was on hold with support for this incident, I noticed that I had received a 1* for "Service".

I have absolutely no idea what happened here, but some key learning points -

2021, still a world of shit

Name: Aw Jeez
Story:
Here in Pensacola, Florida, passengers often ask "how I did" during the worst of the pandemic lockdowns and such? They ask it in a concerned tone of voice, as if they assume I've done poorly. But I tell 'em, "Great!" The truth is that I did not miss a day of work, *and* I did not see any loss of business. I attribute this to two things:

1) There are plenty of people in my town who *had* to work - those employed by convenience stores and fast-food joints, nursing homes and restaurants...in other words, "essential" or exempted businesses. Many of my passengers were from a (ahem) lower-income strata of society and to work. But also, many of them did not have cars and have come to rely on R/S to get to and from work.



2) I assume that a lot of Uber/Lyft drivers are older, and many of them may have "health issues," otherwise, they'd all probably have regular jobs. My thinking goes that because many(?) R/S drivers fall into one or more "at-risk" category, they stopped driving out of, as they say on TV, "an abundance of caution." End result: Fewer drivers on the road competing for the rides.

Whatever the actual reasons, I did not have to stop driving nor did I lose any income at all in 2020. I hit all of my admittedly modest daily income targets, and I found that I could achieve them in fewer hours per day than in the pre-pandemic days. Most days, it was non-friggin' -stop...ping-ping-ping. I worked hard all my life; I did not take this "job" so I could work hard some more.. Sometimes I'd kind of feel guilty about stopping early and "abandoning" passengers who needed rides. But after my second beer, those feeling passed.

I know that my experience here in my town was probably not typical, but I hope that all of us who continued to drive through this (wink-wink) "pandemic" did as well.
