Name: #1husler
Story:
So I wasnt vigilant enough on "pre-screening" Lyft rides on arrival tonight, and got stuck with a particularly obnoxious multi-stop which involved PU at pax's buddy's place, then stopping by pax place to PU his dirty laundry (I told him I could give him 3 mins...and he came running out of his apt at 2:50 with a full laundry basket)....he told me he was going to his girlfriend's place to do his wash...I was relieved when we arrived...the girlfriend came out, he handed over the laundry, I slide "end ride" and then...

Pax: Where are going to next?

Me: Just...my next PU, why?

Pax: Can I come along, or...at least until you PU, then you drop me off some where along the way, I can show you where I need to go, so I can get some food.

Me: Oh ok, I get you, huh no dude, I'm....not going anywhere near anything like that on this route, sorry, but next time?

The pax reluctantly left my car...I locked and got out of there....I've had pax try to coax me into adding stops like this during the ride, and even some asking to add them after the ride, but then offer a tip but...I've never seen one ask for an extra stop at no cost after the ride ends....I guess desperate times call for desperate measures.

Name: wallae
Story: Will they?

Name: BobDaScotty
Story:
Context: White immigrant driving in Philly

I am only able to drive nights and early mornings for good reasons so my experiences are often 'fun'

So, picked up a pax, black woman who was doing at-home care that kept me waiting for two minutes but she apologized as soon as she got in the car so I thought nothing of it as she seemed nice.

We made our first stop at a gas station nearby that took her 8 minutes, she got in the car and I was driving to her destination when her tone did a 360° flip and she harangued me for following the GPS route which was only 15 seconds and one turn away from the only possible, logical subsequent route.

She was really turning nasty and irrational even as I pointed out the route was the fastest and lowest milage possible of three options on waze & uber nav so I pulled over, cancelled the ride and asked her to leave my car.

She refused, unleashed a further torrent of abuse so for the first time ever after 1500+ rides I called 911 to get her out of my car.

I gave the operator an accurate description of my car with hazards on and a squad car blew right past my vehicle even after me flashing my hibeams.

Two more 911 calls of police fail (gods help me if I am ever being assaulted!) and an hour later another uber arrived and she got out, maskless after calling me among other insults a n word.

I called diamond support with my story, informing them that I had dashcam footage of the whole trip but they said that they could not expunge the 1* she gave me.

I drove to the nearest cop shop and a Sgt stated that no crime was committed as I initially invited her into my car despite me repeatedly telling her to leave.

What a frustrating night...

Thoughts, anyone?

Name: Guido-TheKillerPimp
Story:
Your all familiar with this ride.
Friend/waiter/bartender etc asks you to drive drunk dude home, on their account.
No problem. The ride is uneventful and usually short.
Arrive at destination and drunk dude wakes up and says: "Whadda' I owe ya?"
The quick thinking you, blurts out whatever amount you think you can get away with.
Never had any resistance to my $20 "fare" 😂

Name: Guido-TheKillerPimp
Story:
- picked up "Tammy" last night.
- We exchange pleasantries and then, BAM!!!...I go into a temporary state of shock. Why? Read on.
- Tammy was like no other pax I have ever had in 4 years of RS driving.
- Before I even put the car in drive, she says: "How much can I pay you to go to the McDonalds drive-thru for me?"
(state of shock sets in!)
- I truly was silent for what seemed like forever at this display of courtesy.
- Finally regained my senses and thanked her for being so courteous and respectful, while also explaining that 99% of paxs expect us to do all kinds of stops, drive-thru, etc for free.
- I returned the courtesy and told her "no charge/tip necessary!"
- So to all paxs/riders, see how far just a little bit of courtesy will get you! 😀

Name: Young Kim
Story:
So is saturday night and right now it's about 1:37 a.m. and I'm in the west side of Chicago. I had a couple of guys mid-thirties probably from one of the north suburbs who were somehow on the west side. They asked me to go to some corner I think it was by jackson and lotus.. one of the guys ran out and ran to a group of four young men standing on the corner. Then he ran back to my car.

A few questions were asked like did you get it? Followed by a yes. And then I dropped them off by some train station... My question to you guys is do you say anything, or do anything? In this case I just kept my mouth shut... 

By the way they were talking.... it was not weed...

Name: FLKeys
Story:
Friday night pick up a lady at a house that had too many drinks to drive. Nice 12 mile trip. I keep my XM Radio set to Classic Rewind. A mile into the trip Joe Walsh - Life's Been Good comes on. About 1 minute in she says can you change the radio station? Sure, what would you like. I don't care, turn on Country. I say you have these options in Country and she says Y2Kountry would be great.

I turn on Y2Kountry and a few minutes later she says can you turn on classic rock. Sure, you have a preference? Just torn on 103.1 FM. Okay. Guess what was playing? Yep, Joe Walsh - Life's Been Good.

Can you just turn the radio off? - Sure. hit Classic Rewind and turn it off. 2 minutes from the house, does your radio work can we hear music? Sure, I turned it off when you asked me to earlier. Turn it back on and say is classic rock okay. She replies, I guess.

I drop her off and leave. No tip. 

The next morning I notice I have a 3⭐ in my ratings. I always found the 3⭐ to be the most worthless rating there is. Wish she would have given me a 2⭐. I have been without one of those for a long time now.

Name: Juggalo9er
Story: Going south on 75 near Houghton lake at an *cough* safe rate of speed. A deer decided to end its existence, mind you the Air bags did not deploy. Pictures for humor

Name: Benjamin M
Story:
Yay me. Not counting Lyft, I think that's around 2k.

Mixed feelings, Uber trip 3,000 was a somewhat regular pax getting off work from a nursing home, annoying tick of constantly making a "tsst" noise and a phone conversation regarding COVID-19 cases in the facility - rear view mirror check, nose hanging out. Destination, just outside of the hood.

Two and a half years. 2020, starting in March, sucked. 2021, more of the same so far.

Working on trying to figure a way out, meanwhile trying to make the most out of my days on the road. People yesterday were great, two actually tipped, and today was beautiful. One day at a time.

In these 2.5 years and 3k+ trips,

Name: #1husler
Story:
I'm usually much more vigilant, even militant, about this, especially during Friday and Saturday night driving, which is drunk and druggy prime-time around here. For example, if I roll up to a bar, club, at night on weekends, I'll make very sure that a pax doesn't look too wasted before I unlock and I let them in my nice car, to lower the chances of them throwing up, getting too belligerent, etc., just being in insufferable pain the butt.

So I have no idea how and why I let my guard last night, but I did.

I rolled into a higher end residential neighbor (not bar or club) for a PU, parked, and was fiddling with my phone, not paying close enough attention to my environment...some how I left the car doors unlocked.

The next thing...I heard the door open, I said hi and introduced myself, then turned my head to see two women straining to hoist this big (6' 2''?), burly semi-conscious drunk into my nice car. "Oh, hell no, ladies", I responded, "seriously, you can't....", "thank you...bye....", they cut me off, then took off, leaving this incoherent drunk, who slouched horizontally across my backseat and went to sleep, even snoring.

I checked the ride and...it was long, like 20+ mins, but most of it on the interstate, and at least it was another residential (not commercial) address so, I could probably get him out the car and to the doorstep, or on his lawn. He was too blasted to be any trouble to me, though he might throw up in route.

I decided the quickest route out of this situation would be to simply, hustle him from point A to point B.

That's what I did.

I gunned it up the 1-10 to cut the time, got him to the address....parked, and woke him up.

He was still too sloshed to talk but...looked slowing around, seemed to recognize his place and pointed at it and grinned.

Ok, great, I helped him out the car, and luckily the 15 min "cat nap" revived enough of his motor abilities that he could sorta make a slow zig-zap like walk to his house without my help (I wanted as little end game involvement as possible)...I watched him enter, ended the ride, then got the hell outta there, logged off and went home- No more Friday night drunks!

Name: Ridesharegal31
Story: Last night I picked up two questionable individuals at a hotel in a bad part of town to go to a dispensary in another bad part of town and then back to their hotel. Being a woman I already feel like I'm out of the safe zone. so when we get there, I ask how long it will be and he says they'll be right out. So I decide to stay and wait but 10 minutes passes by and they are still not out so I ended the ride and left. Of course he gives me a one star but I feel it was reasonable what I did.

Name: csullivan68
Story: Uber is the best thing that's ever happened to me, and im so glad I decided to give it a try. I am making money hand over fist between Uberx, ubereats, door dash, and Lyft. There are times where I make 30, 40, 50, or even more per hour for just driving around. Every day is like an adventure where you never know where you will end up or who you will meet. It's like playing a video game on your cell phone where your goal is to make as much money as possible. I make way more money than I need at this point it's all about trying to break my personal records of how much money I can make in an hour, a day, or a week. I love all the unexpected big trips and tips that come out of nowhere. I literally cannot help but stumble onto a huge pile of money every time I hit the road. This is by far the best job I have ever had, and God bless Dara Khosrowshahi.

Name: Stevie The magic Unicorn
Story:
So... 

Around 2:45 am I get a taxi ping..

(insert shit-hole motel name and you get the idea)

party of 1 wheelchair/can transfer

😪

Why did I accept this fare.

Roll up to the hotel and he’s toes to the curb,

who hoo...

He has no legs...

😪


I get out of the car and I smell it
Old guy who doesn’t shower regularly with health problems...




5 excruciating minutes later.... I start to put the wheelchair in the trunk.

I want to go to the Denny’s on lee rd.

“They arnt open late night anymore sir”

“really?”

“yep”

“well let’s go past anyway I want to see for myself”

😐

I drive over and the place is dark... dark enough we don’t have to get out.

“ok can you call the ihop on east colonial and make sure they are open?”

Ok...

find it call in in... they are open!

Ok yeah ihop..

I drive him down to the ihop..

if I buy you breakfast Will you turn the meter off?

(oh look an offer for free food, yeah I ate a. HOUR before)

“Sir that’s a really nice offer but I just ate.

“oh well here you go, keep the change”

“Can you come back at 4;00? I don’t want to pay to have you wait.” (Currently 3:15)


I look at the dispatch computer.. there ain’t shit, it’s 3:15 am and covid is making mornings extra lousy with the lack of people flying.

yeah sure .... (why the hell I said yes to this is a total mystery)

So I arrive back and another 5 minutes to get him loaded:

“Oh shit” I hear in the back.

“Everything ok back there?” I ask afraid to ask.

“I think I’m oozing out of my leg”.

🤢🤮

Not “bleeding” OOZING!

what oozes?

Well any pus filled whatever I don’t want it to think about.

I get him back to the motel and out of the car and there’s a streak across the seat that starts snot green and transitions smoothly into bloody red.

🤢🤢🤢🤢🤢🤢🤢🤮🤮🤮🤮🤮🤮

Sorry all I have is another $15.

😪

Fml

I look at the time. 4;30. I start heading for the shop and I see a ping hit.

4T.

it’s accompanied by w fleet wife messfage.

4t going to Mco

so great it’s like a $40 airport fare I’m nearby and can’t take it due to the... pusy bloody mess.

I make it to the shop and top off the tank, my phone goes off.

“Hey Stevie there’s no one else close can you get that airport fare it’s like w $40 fare.

“No... that last guy had some kind of something burst open and it smeared blood and pus on the seat. I’m going back to the shop.


and that’s how my Monday/Tuesday ended,

$340 gross revenue $190 profit...

Name: Stevie The magic Unicorn
Story:
So I picked up this dude at a bar around midnight.

He wants to make a stop at a liquor store and to get some food.

Ok sir whatever...

Liquor store goes without a hitch we go past a Wendy’s and make a stop at the drive thru...

I immediately hear the sound of rustling drive thru bag and the sound of drunk eating.


Less then 5 minutes later we get to his home and he pays. He’s left a mess, suprise surprise and doesn’t tip much at all.

He stumbles in so I’m in his drive way cleaning up the back seat. Handful of fries (I had the drink in the front cup cup holder because there’s no cup holders in the back seat (a total lie but he was drunk enough to beleive me and I’ve done this 1000 times)

So... low and behold there’s another $20 bill on the back seat.


So I throw HIS fries in his bush in front of his house for the ants to eat.

And I’m laughing all the way to my next fare.


Instant karma?

I mean right?

or should I feel guilty?

I’d take an honest judgement.

Name: Guido-TheKillerPimp

Name: MyJessicaLS430
Story:
What I like about deliveries is that we are informed of the expected pay and trip information without the need of maintaining the 85% AR nonsense. While the way we run our business can differ greatly, it is fair to assume that it only makes sense to accept those with promised tips. 

Contrary to my belief, it looks like there are always drivers who love taking unprofitable offers that we would decline in a split second probably because of the combination of more rookies / desperate drivers / add any plausible causes here. As you may know, Home Depot, Apple and Best Buy deliveries are basically community service (long trip + $0 tip). To test the hypothesis that low-ball offers are never left behind, I have tried bidding a few. Sometimes when I was still reading the details (dimensions, weight, etc), the offer had already expired :eeking:!!

Can there be a possibility that I may have missed something? According to my experience, never expect a dime of tip if a customer does not offer any upfront although there can be miracles. One time I was tipped $30 cash for delivering 2 large bottles of bleach and a microwave oven. Does the vast majority of our fellow drivers accept what are made available? Every time seeing a ridiculous offer gets accepted in no time, I cannot help but shaking my head.

Name: Igimba331999
Story: So I signed up for the survey and research thing. When I answered their questions wrong, I got booted from the research group. Anybody surprised by this?

Name: Cvillegordo
Story:
I have a regular pax that I have driven to/from her work as well as a few other places over the past year. She lives in the housing projects, she is quiet and polite - most of the time. On a couple occasions I drove her together with a friend, and she was a different person; snippy and somewhat rude. Since I encounter other snippy and rude pax, this didn't really bother me. However, two incidents made this a problem. About a week ago I got a ping to pick her up a few blocks from her home. The address is a location where there have been a half dozen shootings in the past month, also public housing. I stopped on the street and carefully monitored my surroundings including the large parking lot of front of the apartment buildings that I assumed the pax would come from. I waited about two minutes and a young man approached across the grass, said "Lyft?" I answered "No." and got this in reply; "Then get your b.it.ch as.s out the street." I immediately obliged and left, canceled and got the fee. I got an immediate phone call from the pax; I told her what happened and she screamed; "That's my brother!" Too bad. 

This past Saturday night, I got a ping to pick her up at her workplace. When I arrived, after a couple minutes four young people, two girls and two boys (my regular was not one of them) came running out, laughing, all carrying several large bags from the closed store. I suspected they had just enjoyed a private no-charge shopping spree, but I'm not going to judge. They surrounded the car and began yelling, talking excitedly and yanking on my door handles. Only one was wearing a mask. I called out; "Sorry! Maximum three passengers. Masks required." This resulted in an immediate chorus of vociferous verbal abuse. (Flashback to a couple hundred traffic stops.) One maskless young man approached my door and pressed his body against my partially open window and proceeded to give me some serious hood eyes and attitude. I repeated the rules, realizing that he was very close to attacking me, called out "Watch your feet!" and pulled away quickly. As I did he threw a handful of something in my face, most bounced off the window but a couple hit me. (Throwing a "missile" at a moving car in Virginia is a felony.) The "missiles" turned out to be French fries, but I have gotten this offense charged before for rocks, gravel, a book, a bunch of keys, and an apple to name a few other "missiles." 

I went around the corner, canceled and got the fee. Called support, described the incident, they escalated to another team immediately and I described everything again to a very articulate, intelligent sounding support rep. Within half an hour I got an email saying that I would not be matched to this person again, and then a bit later another email adding that she had been banned from the platform. Satisfying, but I wonder how long that ban will last? Also, since I have taken several other pax to/ from this girl's workplace, chances are good that I'll see her again. That will be interesting. The most annoying part of this to me is that in spite of two dangerous incidents involving residents of the same housing projects, and in spite of multiple shootings in that location recently, I'm guessing that if a pax complains that I would not pick them up because of their race, I'll get deactivated. Do me a favor I suppose, but I do enjoy having this part time gig available. My cancelation rate is going to continue to climb

Name: Guido-TheKillerPimp
Story:
I vividly recall this one time being pinged to marina. Some dude then pulls up to my car with a dolly loaded with 6 or 7 old, dusty, cobweb infested, leaking marine batteries that he expects to load in my car for a trip to the recycling center. 
I simply refuse and tell him in no certain words that he's outta' his mind. No way are those batteries being loaded in my car.
"But you have to, that's why I booked this trip!"
That's when I burst out in laughter as I drove off and parked around the block, to wait out the timer and collect the cancel fee.
What a Jackass!

Name: FLKeys
Story:
I have seen post on here regarding Uber and the Background check. I started driving over 2.5 years ago and never once since I was approved seen a message from Uber about a back ground check.

Yesterday I did my first airport run and as usual I turned on last ride before I got there as I don't want a rematch if there is no surge. I dropped off the PAX and see that there is a $14 surge. I go to turn ride requests back on and get the message there is a problem with your account.

Open it up and have to agree to a background check, do that and it gives me suggestions to read wile I wait.

Can't go online and score a surge ride. Oh well I head home. I start thinking about the posts I read here about how it took weeks to get back online. I was getting pissed that they did this to me on a Sunday, a good money day.

I got home tinkered around with my boat and decided to check the app. Surprise, I was able to go back online. Wish they would have send me a notification of some kind.

Oh well after 2.5 years I finally know what you guys are talking about with the background check. Never had to do it before.

Name: Monkeyman4394
Story: In terms of story, this is more micro-fiction. I was recently disappointed that I didn't get a good picture in traffic of a license plate that said: I Love D. Today sort of made up for it. It's hard to see, but the second letter is a Q.

Name: Young Kim
Story:
So I was in the west side of Chicago which is a relatively dangerous area doing an Uber Eats order for a burger king. (The delivery just completed at 1:27 a.m.) When I made the delivery the lady came down and said could you please deliver it to some other address. So I told her let me GPS it and find out where it was. She gave me an address that was about 7 minutes away by cicero and Chicago avenue.

Since the delivery address could not be changed on the app she suggested that she could pay me in cash. I agreed because there was no real way to change it through the app anymore. When I asked her how much should be willing to pay she surprised me and said $30! I seriously thought she was just going to offer $5 because it wasn't very far.

So she pulled out a $20 bill and 10 singles and just handed it to me and said *you look like someone I can trust."

so I just exchanged phone numbers with her so that I could contact her when I got to the delivery location so her friend could come down and retrieve the food. The delivery went without a hitch and she took me even tipped me more on the app afterward!

This was quite a surprise so I just wanted to share this. I was surprised that somebody would be so willing to trust someone after the delivery was complete ...and also offer such a enormous amount of money for such a short distance. I'm glad that I give off that vibe that I am a trustworthy person.

Name: Young Kim
Story:
I had a pax last night who I picked up from chipotle restaurant. she was telling me about how her manager cannot get anybody to work because the unemployment was extended another 11 weeks.

She was upset because most all her co-workers decided to take the unemployment but for whatever reason that I couldn't figure out, she did not get it herself. She said her manager was quite upset because he couldn't get enough workers. And she was not happy that she picked up all these extra hours that she really didn't want because her manager asked her .......that someone HAD to do those hours.

She was also upset at us Uber drivers as well... She doesn't drive and she uses Uber exclusively to get to work and from work back to home. These days she has to wait up to 30 minutes to get an Uber, so to be safe she plans one full hour earlier for her commute.

I tried to defend all the workers on UI because maybe they all either need a vacation and/or are scared of the virus. 
She wasn't having it at all... She called all of us lazy and all of her co-workers lazy. This made me feel sad...

(Below are requests all from one night)

Name: WNYuber
Story:
The World Health Organization says this deadly virus is a huge issue and it has hit the mainland USA. 
We don't know where these Pax have been or who they were in contact with. I've never been as sick during the Winter as I have been lately since driving Uber.
I'm pondering driving with one of these on......



Kang what do u do if u pick up a client and they are just hacking away back there? It's 10 degrees outside and u can't(shouldn't) open the windows. You pray to God the ride ends soon but your hitting every traffic light. They are coughing, sneezing, and germs are flying everywhere for the entire 20 minute ride.

Name: Young Kim
Story:
So tonight (Sunday), I went out after tutoring a student in math... and got a ping that was twenty minutes away, by Lake Michigan. I was about to cancel but I got a phone call from the pax. I answered and there was a frantic voice on the other end:

(pax): "Please save us! We are stuck in the Chicago Botanical Gardens!, and we have a child in a stroller...and we are freezing!"

(me): "What is going on?!"

She explained that when the Chicago Botanical Gardens closed, she, her boyfriend, and her baby left thinking that they can easily get home. She tried to get an Uber and Lyft, but all cancelled... one after another after another. She had been out in the cold with her boyfriend and child for nearly an hour. She said they were freezing in the cold, and sounded totally desperate. She said her and her boyfriend's phone was about to die, and I was basically the last hope.

They saw some light show at the Botanical Gardens, and the place had closed a while back... I agreed to get them. I drove the twenty minutes from like west of Northfield to the gardens. When I got there, I saw that the entrance road INTO the gardens was closed! I called her and asked her where she was and that I could not get in.

She sounded increasingly frantic, and said there was no one there around them to ask, and it was so dark. I guess all the staff left, and they were all alone. She could not make out anything except that her boyfriend and baby and her were next to a big lit up Christmas tree. I then put my hazards on, and drove around until I saw an open road (but it was an "exit only") road. It was one way the wrong way... but I went anyway because it was private property, and there were no other cars anywhere, so I could see if there would be a car driving towards me...(e.g. I drove through one of the exit roads that led OUT of the gardens, and into the park.

I drove around for a bit looking for them, and she stayed on the phone while I drove. I could not see any lit up Christmas tree... The Chicago Botanical Gardens is HUGE, and finding a few people in the dark seemed hopeless. She said she and her boyfriend were getting completely panicked, because the boyfriend's phone was about to die, and hers was as well. I said I would continue to search, and said I would find help.

As I drove around for a while, I finally saw a car in the distance with a man wearing a shirt with those yellow florescent strips on it. I was so happy to see him, as there seemed to be NOBODY else in the park. I think it was around 11:00 pm at night. I drove right up and explained the situation. I put her on and she told him about the surroundings....

He immediately knew where it was, and said he would drive there and have me follow him. So I did...

About a minute later, we both saw them! and the baby stroller...

They ran up shivering. They both thanked me and the man who helped me find them. After getting in, she explained again how she requested and got cancelled on... again, and again, and again.

She said I was like a savior today (like a ER doctor, firefighter, or other rescue worker). She said that without me, they were about to completely panic, as they saw no other way to get home. I drove them about 20 minutes to Rogers Park, IL to their apartment. She told me her life story which was so interesting and full of adventure. She was 25 years old and inexperienced about life. She thanked me over and over again about my not cancelling on her, and how I was so great because I did not give up on her, her boyfriend, and her baby boy. She said that Christ answered her prayers today. She explained that she saw no other way of getting home if it were not for me.

When the ride ended, I showed her and her boyfriend a few magic tricks like this one that I thought the young child would like:


I am posting this feel good story because there was a moment like today where I felt really happy that I could help someone as an Uber driver. She made me feel like a hero!

Name: The Gift of Fish
Story:
A while back I did the Santander Uber lease (I know, I know). A year into the lease the car was totalled by another driver and, because he was underinsured, Uber's insurer at the time (James River) paid me the value of the car.

James River assessed the value of the car at $23,000 and Santander said the payoff amount (or the money still owed to them in the lease contract) was $21,000. James River said that they would send the settlement to Santander, whom they expected to deduct the payoff amount and send me the $2,000 balance.

When I got in touch with Santander to let them know what was happening, they claimed that, since the car belonged to them, they would be keeping the whole settlement from the insurer.

I responded that, although they owned the car, I owned the insurance policy and was the insured and beneficiary of it, not Santander. I told them that a lienholder is entitled to their financial interest in the asset; not a penny more or a penny less. However, Santander insisted that they would take all the money.

I called James River again. The said that Santander's position was highly unusual. They told me the same as I told Santander - I was the insured and was the one entitled to the settlement, less any lien balance due. They agreed to send Santander a check for the payoff amount and a separate check to me. The loss adjuster said that this was the first time he had ever had to do that. 

I phoned Santander to inform them that I had bypassed them, that they'd only be getting the $21,000 and that they should be grateful for it. I never heard from them again.

My question is: has anyone else ever come across such a scam attempt by Santander or other finance house when they have a lien on your car and your car is totalled out by an insurer for more than the payoff amount?

Name: #1husler
Story:
2021 seems to be the year that pax are determined to take bizarre and unexpected trips with RS (ie, conning an unsuspecting driver to go through a drive through COVID testing site, etc) inclusive of trying take a Uber into Mexico!, how do I know? Well...

Yesterday I got ping in Tucson, did the PU only to see that the pax was going to the Arizona/Mexico border at Nogales, about 90 mins down the I-10. He asked me if it was "ok"?, and I decided I'd go for it, because I had time, its a beautiful drive and a neat place.

On arrival at the border at Nogales, the pax informed me that he wanted to me to drive him across the border into Mexico, and then another 4 hours to Puerto Penasco (Rocky Point), and would pay me $300. It seemed a bad idea for a number of reasons, such as...that road is in very poor condition (a storm washed it away years ago), the wait to re-enter the US is looong, oh and my car isnt insured in Mexico, etc., etc.

So, I declined the offer, and instead advised the pax about how to take bus from the Mexican side of the border, left him there to cross on foot, did my shopping, then drive an hour up to Green Valley/Happy Valley to get rides up back to Tucson.

Name: ANT 7
Story:
I've got 4-5 regular repeat clients that I can safely call my favorite pax.

One of them is this pair of identical twin sisters. Yes, there have already been "movies" done on that theme.

Both of them are 30ish, amazingly smart and conversant about anything, speak multiple languages, are very, very, good looking, they look EXACTLY the same too, as in, not a hair is out of place, and they are also flight attendants for the same major airline.

I always pick them up individually at 6-7 AM in the dark, so we have kinda become rideshare buds over the last year, and they have started playing games with me, using each others account and playing along that they are the other sister until the ride drop off where they tell me the truth.........nicest people ever.

Name: #1husler
Story:
I rolled with a pax last night who, when she got into my car, said she was sooo relieved I wasn't the "Lyft Nazi".

When I inquired about this, I was told about a driver in this market, whom she and other drivers apparently know as the notorious "Lyft Nazi" (not to be confused with the notorious RBG).

She said that, this driver of infamy will pull up and crack the window just enough to bark out a laundry list of rules and regs (ie, stop where you are and listen, mask on before you approach this car, seat belt on immediately you enter, no food or drinks in the car, my music, my directions, etc, etc), then inform you that if you dont agree "you can find another ride!, because its my car and you are my guest!".

She said she and her buddies DONT like the Lyft Nazi, and were always one starring this dude and complaining...but that he's still out there plying our roads....I'd think, he more or less has "the right" to state his TOS and pax can consent or not, none of this technically conflicts with Lyft TOS, so he'd be good to go...just that his rating would plummet, but then he'd get deactivated for that too, right?

I had never heard about anything like the Lyft Nazi, yes...I'll remind a pax to dash on a mask, tend to ignore "music requests", I'll sorta tolerate and humor persons wanting to "give me directions", and whether they buckle up on the backseat or not is not my problem (Im not a kindergarden teacher)...of course, no eating in the car, no no no.

I dont know if the Lyft Nazi reads these forums?, but...Lyft Nazi, are you out there? Can you tell us know more about your mode of operation? Perhaps...you're dealing with pax PTSD and this is your reaction? Or, how and when did you develop this strategy? Can you tell us more please?

Name: Stevie The magic Unicorn
Story:
So like I’ve said before,
It doesn’t matter how many people your car can seat someone will come along and try to swueeze in more:

I’n down at Disney magic kingdom tonight.

some folks walk up and they tell me 7...

ok I walk them to the van behind me.

I see the driver refuse them service.

“Hey folks umm what’s going on?”

“De have 9, can’t take 9 and they won’t split the fare” (yes they expect to clown car 9 people into the van

I roll my eyes..: fricken idiot as I talk to the other cabbie and he tells me that they were holding babies and saying they didn’t count.

“**** yes they count” I tell

Yeah... yeah.... same old same old.

Another van shows up the same side and they walk up to driver #3.

They walk up to him and the driver points forward but I don’t hear what’s said. He walks up and asks van driver #1 what’s going on.

“they says you won’t take them because they aren’t going far enough”

“no nine of them” van driver #1 tells him. I’m standing next or van driver one and that damn other driver goes and loads 9 of them and drives off.

“What an idiot” I mutter.

“he’s going to lose his job, anything happens and they comin for blood”


So guys... yeah this is a story we’ve heard 1000 times:

Passenger wants to break the rules and says “the other driver does it” and we just stand there rolling our eyes as we watch another driver do it...

Name: ANT 7
Story:
Had a pax setting off my spidey senses during the trip today. I was bored sitting at home, so I went out for the afternoon to drive a bit.

Gave her 5 stars, and forgot about it for a while, but it kept bugging me, so I emailed support thru the app, and asked them to unmatch me with that rider.

They said they did that, and then Uber gave me $5 for the trouble......???? -o:-o:-o:

Anyone here ever had that before ? Must be a diamond benefit, because that never happened in my past lives.

Name: Erik M
Story: Worked the Sunday after Christmas, Dec 27, had pickup request at JWA(John Wayne Airport), had multiplier set to 1.5X but a ride request for Uber XL came in at 2.0X for 48 miles, OC to Glendale. Estimate was $151-$161 so I happily accepted! Start driving, about 1 min towards pickup and cancels(Damn), 30 secs later i get another request for the same drop off location but pickup was about 1 mile outside the airport zone and it came in on my mtiplyer at 1.5X so was estimated $89-$99, I accepted but had a feeling it was the same ride request as 30 secs before. I immediately get a call from the Uber #, its the pax saying the app won't allow them to do the pickup at the airport no matter how many times they've tried so can I please pick them up at terminal B pickup spot. I said "NOPE, you need to get the app to work, we can't do that because some people do that to avoid paying the surge prices and airport fees". Of course they say "I would never do that " and they start begging saying "I just need to get home I've been traveling all day".....too bad, so sad!! I'm sure they got some driver to fall for it which is the shitty part of this situation!

Name: jgiun1
Story:
Just went to Lowe's and bought 
1) one Greenworks power washer ($100 retail value)

2) 6 two cycle Craftsman gas blowers ($110) retail a piece

$2430 total retail price

$230 including tax 


I'd rather hustle without Uber Lyft involved. My car looks alot better with my son and tons of deals over paxholes.

Name: Young Kim
Story:
I picked up a pax from Rogers Park, IL and brought him to the West Loop at a Hilton hotel. He was an overnight cleaning manager. He told me this remarkable story...

He met a woman who he fell in love with in the Philippines in 2004. They professed their undying love for each other and promised to marry. But........he was a cruise ship worker, and was gone for 10 months out of the year. So from 2004 to 2010, they saw each other just two months out of the year as he rode across the world. He shared with me exotic stories and how fun it was to be a cruise worker... and suggested that I personally would have a LOT of fun.. 

In 2010, he got married to his girlfriend in the Philippines. But he was still devoted to his job. His wife was quite unhappy about this... and eventually she ended up in the U.S., in Chicago as a CNA (certified nurse's assistant). They continued this long distance relationship, albeit with tremendous difficulty until this past year...for TEN years!.

In February of 2020, he discovered that his mother died suddenly of a brain aneurysm. He was distraught, and he quit his job and returned home to the Phillippines. After just ONE MONTH, his father died...presumably from a broken heart. Therefore, he quit his job as a cruise ship worker, and came to the United States, Chicago, to be with his wife............finally.

They now have a one month old baby....and his wife is taking time off as a CNA to take care of his daughter. Now he says he is really happy. But he really misses the cruise ship lifestyle... He did tell me that being away from his wife for almost the entire year was really hard and stressful on the marriage. He did say he had his own cabin because he was a supervisor, and there were many temptations.... He did relay the message that cruise ship workers get down with each other all the time. I did NOT ask him personal questions... I knew it was not my place to do so, but I sensed... 

Anyhow, this story had a very happy ending. Cheers everyone!!!!!!!

Name: #1husler
Story:
So my buddy had warned me about pax who get U/L to take them through those drive thru COVID testing sites....I was relieved that I didnt have to deal with one of these yet, but...

This weekend I did a PU at some non-descript community center, and coming into the parking lot saw signs about "testing", which I thought might be driving test, or SAT/GRE test, something like that, didnt give it a 2nd though until...

When the pax jumped into my car, I commented about testing signs, and inquired about "which test" was going on...only to be informed that this was the COVID testing site AND that she just had her test, and would receive the results later...I was like "whaaaat"...why is a pax who might have COVID even in my car?!

Should U/L be dealing with these places? If so, then I'd think we'd need a protocol that...if we're to PU from a potential COVID patient from a COVID testing, we'd need to be informed, and for those who "opt in"... given some kinda "hazard pay".

Name: Cvillegordo
Story:
This afternoon I accepted a trip to "Ivy Dental" without looking closely. There is a dentist by that name here in Ivy, just west of Charlottesville. Picked up a nice Chinese girl at one of the grad student housing buildings at UVA. Very friendly right off the bat, a bit strange that she had a fairly large suitcase maybe. She was quite excited about me accepting her ride when she got in, but my brain was still not processing the information. I started the trip and it was odd that the app continued to process the trip for a couple minutes without showing the route, etc. but I thought it was just a bad signal. I moved away from the building and Boom! 

Distance to destination; 373 miles. Total time: over 7 hours. I dropped down the routing and saw; Ivy Dental. Elmsford, NEW YORK!

I turned to the pax and she clearly saw the look on my face, she said; "We can stop whenever necessary. "

Turns out she was going to Elmsford, NY, her home, needed to get there by tomorrow morning. 

I was genuinely sad to have to cancel, but there was no way I could just take off on a 14 hour+ round trip without some serious planning. 

What would you have done? I wonder if she got a ride.

Name: Big Lou
Story:
My grand daughter and daughter in law decided to Uber to Downtown Disney and back.
To their horror, the driver did not wear a mask and refused to wear on. They just rolled the widows down and didn't way a word. Of course, I did get a call since I'm in charge of Uber mask.

How irresponsible to be in a contained box and not take any precautions.
Not to mention what it says about the responsible drivers out there.

Needless to mention, I recommended a 1 star with a strong statement.

Name: goneubering
Story:
“And he played classical music”, she continued.

“And he gave us two water bottles”, she claimed.

I just laughed and said “Wow!”

i guess she didn’t like my Civic.

Name: FLKeys
Story:
Yesterday I stopped at home for a bathroom break and food, as soon as I finished eating I turned the app back on. Got a right away around 2:05 PM, pick up was at a gas station less than a 1/4 mile from my house. Drop off was several miles south toward a place I like to stage. Got a phone call right away. PAX asked me if I could go to pick-up point and pick her up a lighter and deliver it to her hotel as she needed a lighter, the hotel had none and her kid was in the pool. She would tip me the cost of the lighter plus $5.00.

These requests are normally scams, however they usually want beer and or cigarettes or things totaling a bunch more than a $2 lighter. I tell her I'll do it if she sends the request via a message in the app to cover my butt with Uber.

She sends a message right away and tells me to call her when I arrive and she will come to the car and get the lighter.

Okay, what do I have to lose, I'm heading that way anyway. Plus I have several lighters in my car that PAX have dropped on the floor or seat. I grab one of those lighters, start the trip as I near the gas station, and deliver the lighter. She was pretty nice eye candy in her bikini along with several other hotties at the pool. Walks up to my car and hands me $10 and says thanks. Told me I was the 4th driver she contacted, all the rest said no and cancelled the ride right away. I told her it was a typical scam and that is why I asked her to send the message.

Worked for both of us, she paid just over $25 for a used lighter and I made just over $17 to get near the area I like to stage.

Name: Young Kim
Story:
So last night I had two passengers almost back to back that surprised me on how they even operate in the real day world. The first one was a couple of guys that I picked up around kinsey and halsted in the west loop next to downtown Chicago. They put in the wrong pickup address which was a block away from where they were. Since it was so close I just drove there and then they came into the car. They got in the car and then when I swiped right I noticed the destination was their pickup location! 

So they got very very upset.... And asked me if I could change it and drive them anyway. I said no but they could change the address on their app... After that he got suddenly very upset and stormed out and slammed the door... I called out to him one last time and so sorry for what happened. But he just ignored me completely and went into atrium of his building...

The second rider was even more puzzling. At the end of the ride I told him so the ride is over thank you have a nice day and have a good night and I hope you have a wonderful rest of the year. He said thank you, and then he proceeded to walk around to the other side of the car, opened the door and then got in! (Fully expecting the ride to start!) 

I smiled a big grin and said sorry sir but we're at your home that's the destination that you put. He just sat there for a while...like 30 full seconds... and stared at me and then looked at his phone and called somebody and then got out of the car again and said thank you and have a good night!

There are some passengers like the ones I just mentioned that act in such a bizarre way I hardly understand how they get through the day....

Name: Alantc
Story: Got a request 1 minute pickup 2 minute drop off. Got a message to call passenger, I called when I got there. A india guy answers telling thanks for driving during the virus and I was top driver and so on and so on That I've earned a uber gas card, asking for my number case we get cut off and to give him my permission so he could call me back. Said I wasn't interested and hung up. Few seconds later got another message to cancel ride. I waited my 5 minutes collected my no show fee. So watch out for this scam

FOOD?

Name: kingcorey321
Story: Pictures speak for them self . LMAO .

Name: Ridesharegal31
Story: Times are tough.

Name: Young Kim
Story:
I haven't posted stories in just a little while because I was SO busy over the holidays working multiple jobs, family parties, and doing RS of course. Three stories stand out... I Picked up a guy named Abdul in Rogers Park from a 7-11. He was incredibly friendly. He came out and asked right away if I wanted a free drink at his 7-11 because he works there. I said "sure", I'll take a slurpee! So I went in and got one and of course showed him a cool magic trick to thank him. He was amazed.

Anyways, he told me a sad story about how during the holidays he won't be able to see his wife and 8 year old daughter because they are in Pakistan. He said he was a refugee and went through multiple countries to seek asylum in the US. He was a strong anti-Muslim in Pakistan, so he had to flee suddenly. He has not seen his young wife and daughter in many years. He is very sad about this. He is trying to get them to the US, but he said it is near impossible now with the pandemic. He said he has a meeting with his caseworker in January. I'll pray for him, please do so yourself!

We finished the ride and he was just the nicest guy you can imagine. I am just so sad that he had to separated from his wife and daughter because he would have been jailed or worse back in his home country. Anyhow, I showed him this trick, five singles to five twenties (some of you already saw this in the "Chatter Section"), and he was so blown away and we laughed and laughed! By the way, I always carry a few magic tricks in my car for my passengers. I often do Uber after work at a bar or restaurant, so I have them with me. Abdul loved this and said to me how unexpected it was to see an Uber driver do magic...

Name: Seamus
MyJessicaLS430
Story:
First of all, my post has nothing to do with driving. Rather than posting on the chatter sub-forum, I would like to share this eye-opening experience from Xfinity with the largest amount of audience as possible.

Long story short, it takes numerous back and forth communications only to learn that the line in my new home is still registered with the previous tenant. It is not a news how incompetent Uber support is - reading scripts that are not relevant to the question. You think it is the worst customer support? Look at this Xfinity agent who kept me waiting for half an hour only to hang up :i'm mad:!!




$55 / mo!! Is this the service I deserve along with poor internet reliability? Because of the fact that the available competitors are racing to the bottom (as far as what I have heard), these companies couldn't care less about service quality or reputation.

Name: #1husler
Story:
To my friends from Lyft, why have you been peppering my inbox with these messages:


The reason I (and in fact, MANY drivers) dont accept some ride requests is because your "platform" remains riddled with a number of rides which pay significantly less than minimum wage.

I concur, its best for "the community" to score a return trip McD's drive thru run for $5.00 (and pay me $3.75 for 30 mins of my time, gas and car's wear/tear)... the community always appreciates a timely Walmart pick up to cram two shopping carts worth of groceries, a toddler, service dog into my car to drive .5 mile down the road and pay me $2.25 for that 20 min job....I know third parties dependent on outsourcing rides (with no tips allowed) for their patients who need drivers to drive them home, hold their hands and walk them to their resident doors, at times asking the drivers to open the doors and turn on the lights etc., which is awkward and risky.

Yes, those are few sample of the substantial number of missed ride requests to which you are referring. I will continue to miss them.

Why?, because I've hacked your "platform" by learning which rides (a few mentioned here) pay less than minimum wage so I can intentionally "miss" those "ride requests", and instead cherry pick those which pay more.

Like, for example, last night I got a ping to go to the Greyhound bus depot, only to receive a Uber ping for the airport. Guess which one became a "missed ride request"?...I of course missed the request to go to the bus depot, because I never get tips from there, in contract to the airport (which are longer rides with tips).

I accepted a request from a drunken gentleman last night who wanted me to break down and load his bike into my car...which elicited a cancellation from me (I dont do bikes and avoid drunks in my car, because they've thrown up in there)...my next stop was a high end cocktail bar where I picked up a couple who gave them a $10 ride and received a $20 tip. I hacked your system to make $30 in 45 mins (that included driving to the drunken the bicyclist + canceling his ride). If I had done the Greyhound bus and the drunk bicyclist I would have make less than a 1/3 of that or less.

So you see, no I don't "need a break" (so kind of you to inquire) but rather...I just need to cherry-pick the low stress/low risk, high profit rides out of an otherwise rotten bunch. And yes, this will continue until you realize you cant cajole me into becoming an ant and de-activate me OR change your service delivery model

You have asked if I'm there for pax....and I'd answer the question with a question, asking if you (Lyft) are there for me to be there for pax?

If you sincerely have an interest in making your "platform run smoothly", there are a number of ways you could re-configure Lyft for the betterment of "the community".

First of all, you could peg a driver's wait time to $1.00 a min. Rest assured, I'd gladly do multi-stops, and wait in the car as long as needed. Secondly, you could up the minimum fare to $5.00. This might entice me to stop in and pick up at the grocery store, to drive pax one mile back home.

Or...if you are suggesting drivers offer social welfare services...you could simply have a 501 c 3 non profit arm, where you welcome us to volunteer x amount of their time to render services at low cost or even no cost...that way, I could drive a pax from the homeless shelter to the clinic and know that I'm doing it simply to contribute to society (not necessarily "in it for the money").

This might not solve all the issues between pax (ie, your "community) and me...but it would go a long way to providing more dependable services (at least, from me) and would keep your platform running more smoothly.

Best.

#1Hu$stler

Name: Young Kim
Story:
So I'm working New Year's Eve after I did magic at a restaurant, (around 1:00 am), and was in Lincoln Park, IL. I was listening in on their conversation, and I heard the guy say to his wife, "Our $400 bottle of wine was better than their so called $700 bottle of wine, don't you think dear?" So I overheard them discuss the wine smoothness, flavor, etc. etc. And I chimed in:

(me) "It seems you know quite a bit about fine wines. I can't tell because I am sort of allergic to alcohol. I heard that paying so much for a bottle really makes a difference right?"

(him) "Of course it does!"

And then we discussed how the vintage year (I had known this before) is quite important, even more than the age of the wine. I shared with him that just because a wine is old does not mean that it is great, because the year the wine was produced could have been a bad year for grapes. He agreed and shared with me that 2020 will be an awful year for wines in California because of the fires. To make a long story short, he and his wife always bought extremely expensive wines to drink all the time. And their budget (for just wine) is more than most make in a week.

As I drove to a high rise in downtown Chicago, he and his wife shared with me that they used to go out and eat on most days before the pandemic, and always have breakfast, lunch, and dinner delivered since the pandemic closed many of the restaurants. He and his wife did share that they still often do go out because many restaurants will break the rules and allow in door dining for patrons who they know well.

The wife then warned me that if I go out to dinner with any girl, to not take them to Sephia. She said it was a "tasting 7 course" place in Chicago, and cost about $250 per person BEFORE the wine (which obviously they must have), so they spent $800 last they dined there.

He and his wife then told me I should go to a restaurant which I think was "Everest" in Chicago. They told me that it costs them over $1000 per meal there, but said it is so worth it. The wife said that there customer service is so good, that they have a person standing right behind you at all times, and the second you need to use the restroom, he pulls out the chair the moment your butt leaves it. Then they change the table settings of course...

We discussed a bit of their vacation habits, and I won't go into further details but it was all over the country and world. He said he was in Florida and now in Chicago and will be moving to Wisconsin next year... So I asked him:

(me) "Let me guess, you are in a field of medicine?" (Because he was moving around the country)

(him) "Yes, Facial Plastics and ENT" "My wife is in the field of oncology"...

(me) "I know that is an incredibly lucrative field, as if yours (to the wife). Now I know why you both can afford to go out so much and buy only the most expensive drinks"

(him) "Yes, do you know about the field of medicine? You seem very smart."

I then told him about how I went to medical school but quit and went into the financial world... and do magic, teach physics, and do magic on the side...

(him) "Do you have any tricks with you?"

(me) "I'll show you at the end of the ride"

I did the following trick, minus the suitcase because it would be impractical to open my trunk at the end... He was so surprised and loved it and his wife yelled out an expletive. It was a trick where I take a stack of one dollar bills, then change them into 100s. This was the trick... (I always tailor the magic to the passenger. I knew he and his wife would love anything to do with money).


I posted this story because I am reminded that even during times when people are about to be kicked out of their homes because they can't pay rent or their mortgage, others literally are swimming in money... So of sad...

(Also, just to add, even with the magic tricks... (I showed two more), he and his wife left no tip.)

Name: Young Kim
Story:
I wanted to post the story because I thought it was so interesting. Last night one of my passengers was coming from his apartment to the target by lincolnwood, illinois for his overnight shift. I started the conversation by mentioning how target treats their employees very well because I heard they're giving good hazard pay.

He replied that they are and that they're hiring now at his store in case I wanted to apply. We then talked about how during the holidays everybody's around family and I asked him if he was excited to be around his family. He told me he was from st Louis and he will only be spending it with his roommates.

So then I asked him if he will see his family on zoom. He replied that he would only see his sister and his niece on zoom. So then of course I naturally asked about his parents. There was a long pause... He reply that he hasn't seen his parents since he was 15 years old and he's 40 years old now.

I gauged how he looked in the rear view mirror...and then I just asked gently "could I ask why you haven't seen him in so long? are they still alive?"

He then asked in a funny way "is this taxi cab confession" or a "1 hour psychology therapy session?" I replied that it was not and he felt uncomfortable sharing he doesn't have to...

After a long pause he said "well I guess i'll tell you because I won't ever see you again for the rest of my life. And this is something that I wanted to tell my co-workers but I can't."

What he told me is that he is irish and usually irish people are so close family-wise. But both of his parents were serious drug addicts who abused him mentally and physically. Shortly after he ran away from home at age 15, his sister ran away from home too. He said he has no plans to ever see his parents again and cannot forgive them for what they did to him. 

After he ran away from home he worked odd jobs and stayed at friends homes. he's very proud of what he has accomplished even though he's never gone to college. I wanted to share the story because it's very surprising that people will share their most intimate life secrets with their Uber drivers.

Name: FLKeys
Story:
Saturday night I picked up a PAX and in our discussions he tells me he needs a Uber to the Airport at 6:30 Sunday morning. I tell I'll be up and hopefully I get the ping. I like those Sunday morning airport trips.

Get up at 5:30 Sunday morning and check the rider app. No drivers online yet. I turn the app on at 6:00 AM. I head out the door as I want to pick up something for Breakfast. Before I get to my car I get the ping for a scheduled ride. I see the pick-up point is where I dropped the guy off and it is a 90 minute trip. Scheduled time, 6:15 to 6:30 leaves me enough time to get breakfast plus will insure I get the MAX long pick-up fee.

Less than a mile from my house I my app beeps and that dreaded there was a problem message pops up on the screen. I knew right away Uber was screwing me out of this trip. Sure enough trip was gone. Another 30 seconds go by and I get a ping for another rider. He was closer but still a long pick-up. I grab breakfast and head to pick them up. Had to make sure I got the most out of the long pick-up fee. His drop off was 1/2 mile from my house. Okay, that works.

1 minute after starting the trip I get another ping, the scheduled ride that they gave me before. At this point there is no way I will be to the scheduled ride by 6:30 as I have an 9 minute trip for the ride I just picked up and a 18 minute ride after that to the second pick-up.

About 5 minutes into the first trip I get another ping request, for the same scheduled trip I already accepted as a stacked ping. I'm thinking what the heck.

Ended up getting to the second pick-up at 6:50 am, 20 minutes after the scheduled pick-up time.

Rider is a little pissed off at this point. Says he saw me accept his ride. He got a there was an error message on his screen and I was gone and he got driver unavailable searching. After a while he got me as his driver again. He than got an update message from Uber that he has a different driver, a lady names Carla. About 30 seconds later he gets the there was an error message again. Searching for driver. Than I show up as his driver again.

I explained what happened on my end and we surmised that Uber put him on hold while they had me complete the other trip first, since no other drivers came online they gave me his trip again after I started the other trip. At some point Carla came online and they gave her the trip taking it from me without me knowing as I was doing another trip still. Carla must have cancelled right away so now the trip came back to me.

In the Driving Preferences on the Uber APP I have Trip Swaps turned off. I guess Uber just uses the were sorry there was a problem message to do what they want.

I got the guy to the airport on time, he was very thankful and ended up dropping me a nice tip later that night.

Name: goneubering
Story:
Most of the students enrolled at Lynhurst Baptist Church Preschool in Indianapolis are children of parents who have worked as essential workers pandemic, and nearly all are from families that fall at or below the poverty line, according to the preschool's director, Renee Dixon.

And all 50 of the preschool's students, plus their siblings, received Christmas presents this year thanks to Dixon, who has spent her weeknights and weekends for the past year as an  and Lyft driver in order to make extra money to buy them gifts.

Dixon, who lost three of her own family members to COVID-19, said enrollment at the school, which serves kids ages 1 to 12, dropped in half during the pandemic as students' parents lost their jobs. She also had difficulty finding work as an Uber driver due to decreased demand, so she signed up as a driver with Lyft, too, picking up rides whenever and wherever she could.

"We are thrilled to see her heartfelt story getting national attention, particularly during a very challenging year," a Lyft spokeswoman told "GMA" in a statement. "Lyft was originally created to help build and support communities through transportation so it is wonderful to see people like Renee take that spirit one step further for her students and their families."

When Dixon earned $100 from her driving, she headed to Target to buy not only toys and games for her students, but also essential items like winter clothing. Faced with decreased earnings from Uber and Lyft, Dixon said she also took money from her own paycheck to buy items for her students.

"This year, with COVID and everything that has really been taken away from the kids, at no fault of their own, I had to do something," said Dixon, whose story was . "The location of where the school is, it's not in the best neighborhood, but we make the best out of everything."

Even with the odds stacked against her, Dixon said as of last week, she was able to raise over $2,500 this year to spend on her students.

Name: MyJessicaLS430
Story:
Knowing this question is probably market-dependent, will the pandemic be an additional factor for consideration? Learning from this forum that the best time to drive on New Year's Eve is between 11pm to 4am with the incredible surge in the past years, will that even be available this year?

Personally, I have quit Ubering since the removal of Select. With the paltry $3 here and there (if there are any), it does not worth my time anymore. On the New Year's Eve in 2018, I did a few rides with the last one taken before 10pm. That was a few weeks after Uber replaced the multiplier with flat surge. With the Select fare bringing an older couple to an upscale restaurant and their generous tip, I took home with ~$70 after 4 hours of work. I cannot imagine to only driving stingy people around with base X fares alone before the real money pours in past midnight ($14+ surge in Houston core).

Anyway, to those of you who will be driving tonight, stay safe and I wish you all make bank! A lot here has experience dealing with the drunks and obnoxious but you can only imagine the aggravations associated with the 'festival vibe'. I also know some here have no problems at all driving people unmasked which I respect an individual's decision. However, for those of you who do care, allow me to share this.




Finally, Happy New Year and hope everyone will have a stress-free 2021 without falling ill!

Name: #1husler
Story:
Well, today it finally happened. I saw and encountered a special kinda 2020 ride which I've never seen, or heard of, before...and this after I thought we've been through it all this year...in 2020 I had to take a pax through a drive through food bank (I had a buddy who drove one through a drive through COVID test!) and even knew someone who picked up a felon being released from state penitentiary (true story), but today truly surprised me.

I pulled up to an apartment, where a couple of college age guys were clearly moving house, with all their household junk on the lawn...one mini-van was almost fully loaded, but a ton of stuff remained...then this guy runs up to my car and asks me to open the hatch....after some inquiry, he divulged that he wanted to load up my car (including the passenger seat), then I should follow him in the mini van to his new place. I give him my stock line about not being able to do an extended wait because I have "another passenger" in the queue, canceled the ride and piled out of there. Man. 

I've heard of Uber Eats, maybe there should be an UberHelpUMove?

Name: Young Kim
Story:
I picked up a guy named ar""""" by franklin park illinois. I took him for a 45 minute drive all the way to the south side of Chicago he said by englewood. (The screenshot I took was about 15 minutes into the ride right before I enter the eisenhower) But on my map it says something slightly different. His story was was that he was the father of five. He is only 24 years old though. He has the children with multiple baby mamas.

I asked him what he did to support them and he said he does not have a job but just sells drugs. He had been in jail before the last time was for armed robbery he did 6 months. He said that he has post-traumatic stress disorder and depression.

when I asked him why, he said that because he saw his younger brother and his best friend get shot right in front of him. His best friend was shot once in the head and two times the neck. His brother was shot in the back and in the head. he has also been shot multiple times the last time they missed and shot him through his ankle. He was wearing a cast where he had ostensibly been shot. On his right arm.

He said that both were killed not because they had done anything really serious like kill someone directly. Or steal drugs or money or rat out someone. Rather, they were just pawns in another multiple scoring side game series. He said they are almost like teams on the NBA in Chicago. There's so many active "games" going on. but of course the object is not just for baskets but rather for people.


He said that and he used the words is kind of like a game of "ping pong" out here in the south and the west side of chicago. He said it's kind of like a game of chess as well. When one person takes a piece on one side the other person tries to take a piece on the opposing side. And there are sacrifices on both sides.

I thought that most of the killings would be drug related but he said that's not the case. He said that many killings are part of a larger game going on and a larger war where multiple battles go on in different areas. Where the object is just to knock out as many people on the opposing side. and you sacrifice some of your own members to get to the higher level members.

He said that often the killing is almost on a whim. He said that if you have a friend and somebody "scored " on one of his other friends and was " blocked", then you have an obligation to help him carry out a hit. He said that if you've just met someone then of course you wouldn't carry on a hit but if you became good friends and there was a score to settle then you would sort of have to join in.

He said that it is literally an active war zone and there's so many different battles going on at once. I asked him how many games there were and he said they're just too numerous to count.

He didn't say that there's any specific areas that are more dangerous than another. He said that you have to keep on monitoring who is on any particular corner at any given time. if you go to a corner where there's someone trying to score on your team. , Which means someone's trying to kill someone on your team, then you have to avoid that area. One "score" means that you killed somebody on the opposing team and a "block" means that instead of getting killed you were able to get at least one shot off onto the other person.

He said that after three successful blocks the person trying to score on you must by street principal avoid trying to kill you for at least one week. They can try again after week but then there has to be some kind of majority vote. On who can volley for the next attempted score.

He does not talk to his father as his father has been in jail for most of his life. But he does have 5-year goals which I asked about. He wants to move out of his grandmother's house and he wants to get a job as a busboy at olive garden.

well I told him that I drive sometimes on the south of the west side and I've never had any problem, he was not surprised. he said that if you mind your own business and don't wear any fancy jewelry or drive a fancy car, then in Chicago street principle everyone is supposed to leave you alone. If someone were to inflict serious harm to someone like me who is an outsider then said that other members would actively hunt that person down because I am not actively participating in any active" street game." He said that now that he knows me, he said I would be protected on certain areas participates in. He was Telling other members that he was talking to on his team about me and my car and then I was "protected* from now on. He said that he is part of a rather large group connected to other groups and they would get the word out.

I asked him how hard it is to get a gun and he said that it's so easy that if I wanted one tonight and had a little bit of money I could just pick one up from him.

Of course, I don't feel any safer. After I dropped him off I logged off and I'm back in downtown right now. Common sense is of course i'd rather be in downtown but I do not actively avoid the south of the west side either.

I found this interesting because it was quite complicated and the killings and the settlings of different activities take place sometimes over many years.

(In my screenshot I blocked the name, but it was the name of a girlfriend anyway)

Name: Cvillegordo
Story: There is a sizeable population of people from Congo in this area. I worked with one for a couple years; amazing person, he spoke 6 languages. Almost all Congolese people speak English, French, Swahili, and at least one tribal language. I enjoy talking to them, I lived in West Africa when I was a kid so that is a great conversation starter. Picked a young Congolese pax up today, he was going to work at one of our buffet restaurants. Super friendly and outgoing. He settled into the back seat, opened a case and proceeded to set out an impressive array of toilet articles; deodorant, cologne, lotions. Lord knows what else. So we're driving down the road having a spirited conversation, and this guy is slathering on all these products like he's home in his own bathroom. I was in utter disbelief; so caught off guard that I didn't say a word about it, just continued our conversation. After dropping him off I quickly checked; not a drop of anything spilled; but the smell of cologne is still lingering hours later, even after wiping everything down.
